title: GOALTENDING - ALTERNATING NETS
instructions:
Place 2 nets as shown, facing each other but not in front of
    each other so they are offset. Inside posts can be aligned.; Goaltender starts in one net gets 2 shots, then has to turn
    and butterfly slide to get in the other net and then face 2
    shots again.; Do the sequence twice then rest
teaching_points: Goaltender has to be set, quick turn, then slide to other net
Shooters let goalie get in position before shooting

title: CHECKING SKILLS – 1 UP - 1 DOWN – GAP DRILL
instructions:
Gap and angling drill. Defensemen must touch goal line and
    forward must touch blue line. Defenseman tries to clear puck
    and forward tries to score
teaching_points:
Forward wants to create space by using speed and attack the
    net

Defensemen want to read the forward and create a tight gap.
    As defender approaches he must read the forwards control
    of puck, speed etc. and now must either pressure and “jump”
    him or contain. Defenseman does not want to back in on
    goalie and create a screen. “Stick on puck and body on body”

title: CHECKING SKILLS – CONTINUOUS ANGLING
instructions:
Continuous angle drill. Player shoots puck and then picks up
    a second puck and skates up the wall.; Checking player angles and makes contact turning the puck
    over. That player shoots and picks up a second puck. Drill is
    continuous
teaching_points:
Players angle the offensive player to the wall but taking
    away the back of the net with body position and stick. As
    players move up wall get “stick on puck” and rub them out.
    Stick on ice and play the puck first. Recover puck and attack
    the net.

title: CHECKING SKILLS – FORECHECK PROGRESSION
instructions:
Forechecker angles. Forward around pylon and dumps to
    either corner. Defenseman steps up, pivots and turns to get
    puck from the corner. Fore checker approaches “inside out”
    and forced defenseman “up and out”.
teaching_points:
Players angle the offensive player to the wall but taking
    away the back of the net with body position and stick. As
    players move up wall get “stick on puck” and rub them out.
    Stick on ice and play the puck first. Recover the puck.

Defensemen are encouraged to use good breakout tactics
    such as angle, shoulder checks etc.

title: CHECKING SKILLS – FORECHECK PROGRESSION – F1 – F2
instructions:
Forechecker angles forward around pylon and dumps to
    either corner. Defenseman steps up, pivots and turns to get
    puck from the corner. Fore checker approaches “inside out”
    and forces defenseman “up and out”. Second forward reads
    the dump and shuts down the wall. Either he or F1 makes
    contact and the other player picks up the puck.
teaching_points:
Players angle the offensive player to the wall by taking away
    the back of the net with body position and stick. As players
    move up wall get “stick on puck” and rub them out. Stick
    on ice and play the puck first. Second forechecker reads the
    flow and reacts to the situation.

Defensemen are encouraged to use good breakout tactics
    such as angle, shoulder checks etc.

title: CHECKING SKILLS – LONG ANGLE
instructions:
Gap and angling drill in neutral zone. Defenseman leaves
    goal line and forward from far blue line.; Defenseman must close gap and defend and forward tries to
    score. Forward has advantage with time and space
teaching_points:
Forward wants to use space by using speed and attack the
    net

Defenseman wants to read the forward and create a tight
    gap. As defender approaches he must read the forwards
    control of puck, speed etc. and now must either pressure and
    “jump” him or contain. Defenseman does not want to back
    in on goalie and create a screen. “Stick on puck and body on
    body”.

Defenseman wants to angle and try to influence the path of
    the forward.

title: CHECKING SKILLS – MIRROR GAP CONTROL
instructions:
Playing a delay. Forward attacks and delays by turning to
    the wall. Defenseman closes gap and plays the 1-1
teaching_points:
When a defender identifies an attacking forward in the
    defensive zone, they will lock on and play that 1-1. Defender
    uses good tactics: stick on ice, “stick on puck, body on
    body”, close the gap, protect the house, stay on the defensive
    side of the puck

title: DEFENCE – RETRIEVAL – ATTACK F1
instructions:
Defence and forwards start at blue line.; Coach dumps puck in end zone and defence has to retrieve it
    and skate up ice; Once defence touches puck, forward leaves blue line and
    forechecks as F1.; D should wheel net and attack F1 straight on to force F1 into
    gliding and not allowing F1 to “set the angle” and have to
    guess which way D is going to skate
teaching_points: Fake, shoulder check on retrieval, attack F1 straight on
Skate up middle of ice
Force F1 to guess

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – 1 ON 1 – D USE FEET
instructions:
Gap drill. Forward dumps pucks and defenseman retrieves
    and breaks out the forward. Forward up ice and turns back
    for a 1-1. Defenseman must close gap and play the 1-1.; D body on body, stick on puck, eyes on chest - D work on
    using feet to break up move
teaching_points: Keep eyes on defender, not puck
Use feet to prevent move

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – 1 ON 1 – INSIDE / OUTSIDE
instructions:
Gap drill. Forward dumps pucks and defenseman retrieves
    and breaks out the forward. Forward up ice and turns back
    for a 1-1. Defenseman must close gap and play the 1-1.; Forward uses inside / outside or outside / inside move to
    beat D
teaching_points: Speed, quick feet
“Setup” D with one move, then beat D with another

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – 1 ON 1 – POINT SHOT – NET FRONT
instructions:
Skaters in one corner, D at blue line on opposite side, pucks
    in opposite corner with coach; On coaches’ signal, starts as a 1 on 1 out of the corner, after
    the first shot, the offensive player sprints to far corner to
    pick up a second puck and passes it to the D man on the blue
    line and then heads to the net.; D shoots through screen or shoots for tip; After D shot, net front player must get open to receive pass
    from coach for third shot
teaching_points: Creativity by fwd, stay on defensive side by D
Fwd create gap, D reduce gap – stick on puck

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – 3 PUCK NET DRIVE – 1 ON 1
instructions:
Players start on face off dot in corner circle. Pucks in the
    corner.; On coaches’ signal, player in corner spots puck. Offensive
    player from corner has to retrieve the puck and try to take it
    to the net.; Defensive player has to prevent the player from getting to
    the net.; Offensive player repeat 2 more times for 3 1 on 1 plays.
teaching_points: Quick feet
Fake before picking up puck
Drive to net, puck protection
Defender, stick on puck, stay on defensive side

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – BREAKOUT 1 ON 1 – D JUMP FORWARD
instructions:
Gap drill. Forward dumps pucks and defenseman retrieves
    and breaks out the forward. Forward up ice and turns back
    for a 1-1. Defenseman must close gap and play the 1-1.
    Coaches encourage D challenge in the neutral zone and
    “jump” the forward.
teaching_points:
Forwards want to hustle up ice and create some space to
    attack. Use good individual tactics to challenge the defenseman

Defensemen need to gap up and decide - close the gap and
    “jump” the forward before they get turned or defend the
    middle of the ice and pivot and contain. This may depend on
    each situation and on team philosophy.

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – BREAKOUT 1 ON 1
instructions:
Gap drill. Forward dumps pucks and defenseman retrieves
    and breaks out the forward. Forward up ice and turns back
    for a 1-1. Defenseman must close gap and play the 1-1.
    Coaches need to decide if players will challenge in the neutral
    zone and “jump” the forward or be passive, pivot and
    defend the middle of the ice. Pressure or contain
teaching_points:
Forwards want to hustle up ice and create some space to
    attack. Use good individual tactics to challenge the defenseman

Defensemen need to gap up and decide do I close the gap
    and “jump” the forward before they get turned or do I
    defend the middle of the ice and pivot and contain. This may
    depend on each situation and on team philosophy.

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – INSIDE / OUTSIDE MOVE
instructions:
Gap and angling drill in neutral zone. Defenseman leaves
    goal line and forward from far blue line.; Forward has advantage with time and space – use speed to
    make outside / inside or inside / outside moves
teaching_points: Move feet, gather speed
Use space given
Quick “setup” move then payoff

title: TEAM TACTICS – SKATE PASS SHOOT – REGROUP
instructions:
Player line up along boards on blue line. Place a pylon near
    the top of the circle in the offensive zone and another one
    on the red line near the edge of the centre circle. Coaches
    along boards at far blue line; First player in line backpeddles, receives pass, pivots at
    pylon then skates forward and passes to coach on same side
    blue line.; Player transitions and receives quick up pass from coach
    and drives net for shot. Stop after shot, and then sprint to
    corner for second puck, skate back around pylon in offensive
    zone and take second shot on net; Progression – can 1 touch passes to start drill and with
    coach
teaching_points: Present stick as target
Smooth transition on regroup, open up to coach
Accelerate after receiving pass

title: PASSING – PASS AND MOVE #1
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck, receiving player starts on
    hash marks; Player sprints to face off dot, receives pass, 1 touches it
    back, sprints back to hashmark, receives pass and 1 touches
    it back, skate around top of circle and receives third pass for
    shot on net
teaching_points: Quick feet, present stick as target
Soft hands to receive pass and 1 touch back

title: PASSING – PASS AND MOVE #2
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck, receiving players starts on
    hash marks; Player on hashmarks sprints to dot, player in corner sprints
    up to hashmark and passes to player on dot, who one
    touches it back. Players skate back to original position and
    1 touch pass again.; Player from hashmarks then sprints around top of circle to
    receive pass and takes shot on net
teaching_points: Quick feet, present stick as target
Soft hands to receive pass and 1 touch back

title: PASSING – PASS AND MOVE #3
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck, D out at blue line; 1 touch back and forth, then player from corner skates
    behind net, D skate to mid ice for shot on net.; Shoot to score, shoot for sticks or shot pass for back door
    option
teaching_points: Quick feet, present stick as target
Soft hands to receive pass and 1 touch back
D head up on point shot

title: PUCK CONTROL – CIRCLE CHAOS #2
instructions:
Players in both end zone circles with pucks; Players skate around the circle handling the puck, using
    quick hands and quick moves to avoid other players; On coaches’ signal, players switch circles and then skate
    around circle handling the puck and trying to knock the puck
    off of the other players’ stick.; Once a puck is knocked off the stick that player is out of the
    circle; Go until there is only one player left with a puck on the stick
teaching_points: Quick hands, eyes up
Puck protection, poke checks

title: PUCK CONTROL – CIRCLE CHAOS
instructions:
Players in circle with pucks; On coaches’ signal, players skate around circle handling the
    puck and trying to knock the puck off of the other players’
    stick.; Once a puck is knocked off the stick that player is out of the
    circle; Go until there is only one player left with a puck on the stick
teaching_points: Quick hands, eyes up
Puck protection, poke checks

title: PUCK CONTROL – CORNER NET DRIVE - PROGRESSION #1 – SHOOT IN STRIDE
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck. Drive hard around top
    of circle, keeping feet moving the entire time and shoot in
    stride without gliding.
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving
Players keep their head up when shooting

title: PUCK CONTROL – CORNER NET DRIVE – PROGRESSION #2 – DOUBLE DELAY
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck. Drive hard around top
    of circle, perform a tight turn and delay back towards the
    corner, perform another tight turn and skate in the original
    direction towards the net finishing with a shot.
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving
Protect puck on the delays
Players keep their head up when shooting

title: PUCK CONTROL – CORNER NET DRIVE – PROGRESSION #3 – OPEN UP TO BACKHAND
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck. Drive hard around top of
    circle, keeping feet moving the entire time.; As the coach puts pressure on the puck, open up to the backhand
    or forehand to protect the puck so a shot can be taken
    on net
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving
Players keep their head up
Open up ( heel to heel ) to protect puck

title: PUCK CONTROL – CORNER NET DRIVE – PROGRESSION #4 – DELAY LOW DRIVE
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck. Drive hard around top
    of circle, perform a tight turn and delay back towards the
    corner.; Attack net with speed with low drive
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving, attack the net
Protect puck on the delay
Players keep their head up

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL WARM UP – TAG GAME
instructions:
Players line up outside blue line on both sides of the ice; On coaches’ signal, 3 players go at a time, each one with a
    puck.; One player skating backwards the entire time and other two
    skating forward trying to knock the puck off the stick of the
    backward skater.; If puck gets knocked off stick, the person that knocked it off
    then becomes the backwards skater and a new player jumps
    in. The person that got the puck knocked off the stick is out
teaching_points: Quick hands, quick feet
Keep moving, be deceptive and agile

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION – 1 ON 1
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck. Offensive player drives
    hard around top of circle. Defensive player stays on defensive
    side and tries to prevent puck carrier getting to the net.
    Offensive player can perform tight turns and delays to shake
    the defender.; Defender keeps “stick on puck“; Progression can be to add a pass from the corner after the 1
    on 1 for a second shot on net
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving
Protect puck on the delays
Stick on puck

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION PROGRESSION #1
instructions:
Place players in groups of 2, place 2 pylons 20 – 25 feet
    apart as shown.; Players will go around pylons and then attack the stationary
    player that is standing in the middle while protecting the
    puck.; Protect the puck on the forehand and the backhand
teaching_points:
Deep knee bend for balance and ability to reach and protect
    the puck
Attack, move the puck laterally, then up ice

Protect the puck as you go around the stationary player.
    Start by using arm and leg and progress to turning your back
    to the” checker”

Players may need to slide their bottom hand up the shaft to
    reach and separate from the “checker”

Have players keep both feet on ice on tight turns around
    pylons

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION PROGRESSIONS #2
instructions:
Place players in groups of 2, place 2 pylons 20 – 25 feet
    apart as shown.; Players will go around pylons and then attack the stationary
    player by sliding the puck through the attack triangle, first
    on forehand then on backhand
teaching_points:
Forehand: skate at stationary player, fake and then slide
    puck between feet and stick. The puck should go parallel to
    the “checkers” feet. Players can slide hand up to make going
    over defenders stick easier

Backhand: skate at a stationary player, pull across the front
    of defenders stick then “backhand tap” the puck through the
    triangle

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION SEQUENCE #1 – FH – BH WIDE
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players do an open
    “Crosby” and then attack; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Players approach with speed fake forehand and do a 360
    spin on backhand.

Fake and then get puck on backhand and spin. Keep your
    speed and don’t “dig in” to the ice.
Get your head up and see the ice.

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION SEQUENCE #2 – NO STICKHANDLE
instructions:
Players move down ice around stick shafts and shoot on
    goal.
teaching_points:
Players keep their head up. The stick shafts simulate defends
    and players must attack them.

Players need to move laterally to get around a poke check,
    then move up ice. There needs to be separation from the
    defender. Players should reach laterally and get hands at the
    top of the stick to extend their reach.

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION SEQUENCE #3 – FAST HANDS WIDE
instructions:
Players move down ice around stick shafts and shoot on
    goal. Players now “protect the puck”
teaching_points:
Players keep their head up. The stick shafts simulate defends
    and players must attack them.

Players need to move laterally to get around a poke check,
    then move up ice. There needs to be separation from the
    defender. Players should reach laterally and get hands at
    the top of the stick to extend their reach. Players protect
    the puck by either using arm and leg or turning back to the
    “defender”

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION SEQUENCE #4 – TOE DRAG SHOT
instructions:
Players move down ice around stick shafts and shoot on
    goal.
teaching_points:
Players keep their head up. The stick shafts simulate defenders
    and players must attack them.

Players need to move laterally to get around a poke check,
    then move up ice. There needs to be separation from the
    defender. Players should reach laterally and get hands at
    the top of the stick to extend their reach. Players protect
    the puck by either using arm and leg or turning back to the
    “defender” and finish with a toe drag on the last stick before
    the shot.

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION X 3
instructions:
Players in each corner, one player on dot in middle of faceoff
    circle, 3 pylons on the circle; top, bottom and hashmarks
    closest to boards; On coaches’ signal player with puck has to skate towards
    player in middle and protect puck when going around him,
    skate to any of the three pylons, tight turn around it and
    then attack player in middle protecting the puck each time; Do the same for all three pylons, then go in for shot on net; Run out of both corners, but delay starting time so goalie
    has a chance to get set for shots
teaching_points: Good puck protection, use body, knee, arm to protect puck

Quick feet, move puck to safe area so it can’t be poke
    checked

title: PUCK CONTROL – HANDS – SAUCER SEQUENCE
instructions:
Deep knee bend for balance and obstacles are close together
    to develop quick hands; Attack the stick shafts on the ice by chipping the puck over
    the stick shaft on the ice. Chip the puck up and have it land
    where you can pick it up and continue attack.; Then attack the stationary player: vary this by going wide or
    attacking the triangle of the defender
teaching_points:
Fake one way and pull the puck then chip it up and over the
    shaft. Chip the puck softly as to be able to pick it up

Practice both forehand, where the puck is pulled and comes
    off the toe and backhand chips where the puck is pulled and
    comes off the heel
Have a deep knee bend and a wide base

title: PUCK CONTROL – QUICK HANDS SEQUENCE
instructions:
Deep knee bend for balance and obstacles are close together
    to develop quick hands; Attack the stick shafts on the ice by using whatever you
    wish; use your imagination: toe drags, 360, pushes, separation,
    etc.; Then attack the stationary player
teaching_points: Use proper technique in the selected moves

title: PUCK CONTROL – TOE DRAG OBSTACLES
instructions:
Deep knee bend for balance and obstacles are close together
    to develop quick hands; Attack the stick shafts on the ice by using a toe drag and
    pulling the puck to the forehand: the puck does not touch
    the back of the blade on these drags; Then attack the stationary player: vary this by going wide or
    attacking the triangle of the defender
teaching_points:
This move is done by keeping the puck on the forehand. A
    long drag of the puck

Pull the puck into the body to the front of the blade and
    then play on the forehand

Reach and then pull sliding your bottom hand up the shaft of
    the stick

title: PUCK CONTROL – WARM UP - PUCK PROTECTION SKILLS
instructions:
Players line up in one end at the hash marks; Perform puck handling skills that are key to puck protection
    down the middle of the ice and back along the boards; Fast hands, toe up; Narrow / wide; Open up to backhand; Puck first then feet; Heel to heel; Random moves
teaching_points: Do at a pace where the players can perform the skills properly

Move the puck side to side as fast as possible and as close to
    the feet as possible
Move puck before feet

title: SCORING – O–ZONE PLAY – ATTACK OPTIONS
instructions:
Place 2 D along the blue line, forwards in the corner with
    pucks; Fwd skates behind net and up to hash marks, delays and
    turns back towards corner, performs another delay and turns
    up the wall and then attacks the net; After shot, fwd receives a pass from the coach behind the
    net, passes up to strong side D. D then passes D to D for shot
    on net.; Forward goes to net after passing to look for tip or rebound
teaching_points: Quick feet on the delays, drive hard to net
Be an option below goal line then quick pass up high to D
D quick D to D pass, head up on shot

title: SCORING – O-ZONE PLAY – CHANGE ATTACK OPTIONS
instructions:
Place 2 D along the blue line, forwards in the corner with
    pucks; Fwd skates behind net and up to hash marks, delays and
    turns back towards corner, performs another delay and turns
    up the wall and then attacks the net.; After shot, fwd receives a pass from the coach behind the
    net, skates up the wall and cycles puck with D who comes
    down from Blue line.; D can shoot or pass to forward in slot; Send second forward to add pressure
teaching_points: Quick feet on the delays, drive hard to net
Be an option below goal line then cycle down the wall to D
Get open as an option

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #1 – BH SHOT
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle.
teaching_points:
Players attack “defender” fake, pull puck to the backhand
    and shoot on goal. This changes the angle and makes the
    goaltender move

Attacker would have to move laterally around defender to
    avoid a poke check. Protect the puck and shoot

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #2 – FH SHOT
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle.
teaching_points:
Player attacks “defender”, fakes and moves to forehand and
    shoots. This quick lateral movement changes the angle and
    makes the goaltender move. Make sure player’s head is up
    before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #3 – TOE DRAG
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle.
teaching_points:
Player attacks “defender” fakes, pulls puck across the front
    of defender to forehand and shoots. This changes the angle
    and makes the goaltender move. Make sure player’s head is
    up before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #4 – EBERLE MOVE
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle.
teaching_points:
Player attacks “defender” fakes a shot, pull puck across the
    front of defender to forehand and shoot. This changes the
    angle and makes the goaltender move. Make sure player’s
    head is up before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #5 – SHOOT THROUGH SCREEN
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle.
teaching_points:
Player reads that the “defender” has backed in on his goalie.
    Here player shoots through the screen created. Player can
    shoot around defender or through their “legs”. Make sure
    player’s head is up before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #6 – CHIP – PUCK OFF STICK
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players chip the
    puck off the boards to simulate an offensive zone entry.; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Players will go around pylons and then attack the stationary
    player by sliding the puck through the attack triangle on
    the forehand. Forehand: skate at stationary player, fake and
    then slide puck between feet and stick. The puck should go
    parallel to the “checkers” feet. Player can slide hand up to
    make going over defender’s stick easier

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #7 – CHIP – BH - FH
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players chip the
    puck off the boards to simulate an offensive zone entry.; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Players will go around pylons and then attach the stationary
    player by sliding the puck through the attack triangle on
    the backhand. Backhand: skate at a stationary player, pull
    across the front of defenders stick then “backhand tap” the
    puck through the triangle

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #8 – CHIP – CHANGE PUCK ANGLE
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players chip the
    puck off the boards to simulate an offensive zone entry.; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Player attacks “defender” toe drags the puck and shoots.
    This changes the angle and makes the goaltender move.
    Make sure players head is up before the shot. “Pull it, see it,
    shoot it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #9 – PULL IN PUSH OUT
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender.; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Player attacks “defender”, pulls goaltender move. Make sure
    players head is up before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot
    it”puck in towards the skates and then pushes the puck back
    out on the forehand the whole time and shoots. This changes
    the angle and makes the

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #10 – SPIN TO FOREHAND
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players chip the
    puck off the boards to simulate an offensive zone entry.; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Player attacks “defender” pulls puck across the front of
    defender to and pushes the puck back and shoot. The puck
    stays on the forehand at all times. This changes the angle
    and makes the goaltender move. Make sure players head is
    up before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #11 – PUCK THROUGH LEGS
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players do an open
    “Crosby” and then attack.; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Player attacks and “delays” by turning outside. Player keeps
    speed, sells the fake, turns tight and attacks the net. Make
    sure players head is up before the shot. “Pull it, see it, shoot
    it”

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #12 – PUCK PROTECT TO BACKHAND
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players do an open
    “Crosby” and then attack; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Players reach, expose the puck enticing the defender, then
    pull it between their feet to the outside foot and kick up to
    stick. Head is up observing defender. Bottom hand slides.
    Players can use a toe drag or a backhand drag. A wide base is
    needed.

title: SCORING – 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES #13 - SPINORAMA
instructions:
Players approach “inside out” from the blue line and attack
    the obstacle which simulates a defender. Players do an open
    “Crosby” and then attack; Players approach the “defender” with speed, head up, puck
    under control with the goal of getting a shot on the net. In
    a game the attacker would read the defender. In these drills,
    the attacker can practice a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on a
    stationary obstacle
teaching_points:
Players attack and protect the puck by turning their back
    to the defender. The player simulates they are delaying but
    simply “stutter” and attack the net. A key to the fake is to
    move the puck back then attack. Practice shooting both
    forehand and backhand off this move.

title: SCORING – 3 PUCK NET DRIVE
instructions:
Players start in corner with puck.; Players will take 3 shots on net. First one is a high drive
    around top of circle, finish with shot on net. Go back to
    corner to get a second puck and drive top of circle, delay and
    then attack net for second shot. Go back to corner for third
    puck and drive the net from below the goal line
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving
Quick puck retrieval and quick to net
Head up for shot selection

title: SCORING – DOWN LOW PASS OUT OPTIONS
instructions:
Players on side boards lined up from hashmarks back to blue
    line; Player in corner gets pass and skates behind the net, player
    who makes original pass skates to slot for pass in front.; Net front player then goes below the goal line and receive
    pass from opposite side – continuous rotation from side to
    side.; Progression – Player behind the net – delays then passes to
    net front
teaching_points: Eyes up behind net to find passing lane
Shooter has to control skate to be an option
Quick release, not stickhandle before shot

title: SCORING – NET DRIVE 2 PUCK ATTACK
instructions:
Players along boards on blue line – pucks on face off dot in
    corner circle; On coaches’ signal forward races to net front and stops.; Coach spots puck in corner, player then leaves net front and
    sprints to get loose puck.; Fake before retrieving puck and drive hard to net.; Coach spots second puck and player sprints to get 2nd loose
    puck and drives net again.; Progression – have a player spot puck in corner so it turns
    into a 1 on 1
teaching_points: Sprint to net, stop at net, find loose puck
Fake before retrieval, drive hard to net

On progression, defensive player stay on D side, stick on
    puck

title: SCORING – NET DRIVE – PUCK PROTECTION PROGRESSION
instructions:
Players on dots outside blue line, coaches on dots in corner
    circles.; Players skate diagonally across ice and get a pass from the
    first player in the opposite line.Protect puck past coach to netOpen up and protect puck on forehand or backhand past
        coachStop and spin back inside in front of coach – ( Spin away
        from stick ); Protect puck past coach to net; Open up and protect puck on forehand or backhand past
        coach; Stop and spin back inside in front of coach – ( Spin away
        from stick )
teaching_points: Keep feet moving
Protect puck, place in position that can’t be poke checked

title: SCORING – PUCK CONTROL – PASS UNDER DEFENDER STICK
instructions:
Players on dots outside blue line, coaches on dots in corner
    circles.; Players skate diagonally across ice and get a pass from the
    first player in the opposite line.; Players drive wide and slide the puck between the defenders
    feet and stick
teaching_points:
Players need to extend the puck outside the potential poke
    check. Player wants to sell the wide drive and then slide the
    puck under the defenders stick and drive to pick it up.

This is a good strategy for a defender who is thinking “stick
    on puck”

title: SHOOTING – DEFENCE POINT SHOTS
instructions:
Defenseman skates a figure 8 and takes 2 shots on net. This
    progresses to sending 2 defenseman a few seconds apart.
    This allows maximum reps and gives goaltenders time to set.
teaching_points:
Defenseman need to keep speed, get pucks to mid ice and
    shoot. Get the puck loaded in a shooting position as soon as
    possible.

Head up, “no dust” when handling puck. Coaches can add
    options at blue line before shot such as pulls, fakes, push
    fakes etc.

title: SHOT BLOCKING – SHOT BLOCK – 1 KNEE DOWN
instructions:
Shot blocking with 1 knee down.; Players pass to coach, get into the shooting lane and then
    close the gap and block the shot. Use foam / sponge pucks.
teaching_points:
Get in the shooting lane and skate toward the shooter closing
    the gap. Timing is the key, don’t drop too early.

Drop to one knee to cover the ice. Turn hands so the backs
    of the gloves face the shooter. Stick to the side to avoid
    deflecting into your own face
Tuck in the chin and keep arms and legs “tight” to the body

Be in control as you drop so you can quickly get back up on
    your feet

title: SHOT BLOCKING – SHOT BLOCK - NET FRONT X 3
instructions:
The shot blocking player is facing the net. They turn and
    look for the coach with their stick in the air….they are the
    shooter.; Player finds the lane and then goes toward the shooter to
    close the gap and choose what blocking method to use.
teaching_points:
Get in the shooting lane and skate toward the shooter closing
    the gap. Timing is the key, don’t drop too early.

Drop to one knee to cover the ice. Turn hands so the backs
    of the gloves face the shooter. Stick to the side to avoid
    deflecting into your own face
Tuck in the chin and keep arms and legs “tight” to the body

Be in control as you drop so you can quickly get back up on
    your feet

title: SHOT BLOCKING – SHOT BLOCK – SIDE WALL
instructions:
Coach passes to shooter.; Net front defender must get in the lane, close the gap and
    time their block.
teaching_points:
Get in the shooting lane and skate toward the shooter closing
    the gap. Timing is the key, don’t drop too early.

Drop to one knee to cover the ice. Turn hands so the backs
    of the gloves face the shooter. Stick to the side to avoid
    deflecting into your own face
Tuck in the chin and keep arms and legs “tight” to the body

Be in control as you drop so you can quickly get back up on
    your feet

title: SHOT BLOCKING – SHOT BLOCK - STAND UP
instructions:
Shot blocking by staying on your feet.; Players pass to coach, get into the shooting lane and then
    close the gap and block the shot. Use foam / sponge pucks.
teaching_points:
Get in the shooting lane and approach with stick on the ice
    and legs together.
Close the gap on the shooter.
Don’t turn…. let the puck hit where you have protection

title: SKATING – 4 PYLON AGILITY
instructions:
Place 4 pylons around a circle or anywhere on the ice.; Players start by skating around the pylons in a random
    fashion.; Progression – add a second player and have them challenge
    each other instead of avoiding each other; Progression – two players, 3 players etc…
teaching_points:
Keep feet moving, be creative, and go as fast as possible –
    quick feet

title: SKATING – AGILITY SEQUENCE
instructions:
Players spread out and place stick lengthwise on ice in front
    of themselves; Agility skating skills:Jump from skate to skate over stick, toe tap inside skate
        before jumping back to the other side. Pick up speedOne crossover over stick from side to side – pickup speed –
        get set in stance before going back to the other sideFigure 8 pattern around stick – jump to other side over
        middle of stick – tight turns around each end of stickTransition around stick, heels first at top, ride inside edge at
        bottom. Go both ways; Jump from skate to skate over stick, toe tap inside skate
        before jumping back to the other side. Pick up speed; One crossover over stick from side to side – pickup speed –
        get set in stance before going back to the other side; Figure 8 pattern around stick – jump to other side over
        middle of stick – tight turns around each end of stick; Transition around stick, heels first at top, ride inside edge at
        bottom. Go both ways
teaching_points: Work on technique before speed
Stay low for better balance
Go both directions

title: SKATING – SKATING STRIDE – SIDE PUSH
instructions:
Player is down on ice on both knees; Push to the side with one leg extending it fully for full extension,
    low recovery back to hip or shoulder width.; Repeat for 2 or 3 pushes in each direction
teaching_points: Strong push, extend leg fully, low recovery
Work on strength of push before speed

title: SKATING - SKATING WARM UP – TAG GAME
instructions:
Players line up outside blue line on both sides of the ice; On coaches’ signal, 3 players go at a time, with one player
    skating backwards the entire time and other two skating
    forward trying to tag the backward skater; Whoever tags the backward skater then becomes the backward
    skater and the other two try to tag that player
teaching_points: Quick feet, agility, lateral skating

title: SKATING – TRANSITION SKATING – GAP CONTROL
instructions:
Good gap control drill. Offensive player skates and stays on
    top of pylons. Defender stays below pylons and tries to stay
    within a stick length. Now defender becomes the offensive
    puck carrier and a new defender steps in.; Progression: play drill out as a 1-1
teaching_points:
The defensive player wants to keep a tight gap and be within
    a stick length of offensive player. One hand on stick and stick
    on ice

Limit crossing the feet by implementing proper backward to
    forward and forward to backward pivots
keep your speed
Keep shoulders square to puck carrier

title: SKILLS STATIONS – 4 NET DRIVE OPTIONS
instructions:
4 separate starting locations, 4 different net drivesPlayer starts in corner with puck, seam drives top of circle
        for shot on net – stay at netPlayer starts in opposite corner, double delay finish with net
        drivePlayers start along boards at blue line. First player accelerates
        through neutral zone towards far blue line and turns up
        ice to get pass from second player in line and performs long
        drive – attack coachPlayers just outside blue line and perform stickhandling
        moves around the pylons and stick in a figure 8 pattern.
        Watch for long drive and time drive to net after long drive
        shot.; Player starts in corner with puck, seam drives top of circle
        for shot on net – stay at net; Player starts in opposite corner, double delay finish with net
        drive; Players start along boards at blue line. First player accelerates
        through neutral zone towards far blue line and turns up
        ice to get pass from second player in line and performs long
        drive – attack coach; Players just outside blue line and perform stickhandling
        moves around the pylons and stick in a figure 8 pattern.
        Watch for long drive and time drive to net after long drive
        shot.; Players will take 2 turns at a station then rotate
teaching_points:
All 4 situations require quick feet, drive to net and puck
    protection skills

Players try to “shoot in stride” and avoid gliding before
    shooting. Head up and shoot the puck hard, shoot to score
    on every drill. Stop for rebounds then be aware of next
    shooter

title: SMALL AREA GAME – 1 ON 1, 2 ON 2
instructions:
Small area game starts with players inside the faceoff circles
    in the end zone.; On coaches’ signal, puck gets dumped in the corner and it is
    a 1 on 1 on one side of the ice.; On next whistle, coach dumps puck in opposite corner and
    now becomes a 2 on 2; Play for 30 seconds then switch. If goal is scored right away,
    coach can spot another puck
teaching_points: First to pucks, compete in the 1 on 1

When it becomes a 2 on 2, get open for pass, or stay D side
    on defence

title: SMALL AREA GAME – 3 PUCK 1 ON 1
instructions:
Small area game focuses on gap.; Players play 1-1. Forward attacks net and defender gaps and
    strips and clears pucks.; When coach yells “puck”, forward gets to puck as quickly as
    possible and tries to turn and create space. Defender tries to
    close the gap immediately and tries to “jump” the forward
    before he gets control and space
teaching_points:
Forwards use speed to get to the puck and attack before the
    defender closes the gap. Use individual tactics to attack
    defender.

Defender closes gap quickly and limits time and space of forward.
    Stick on the ice and one hand, “stick on puck, body on
    body” and check inside out protecting the “good ice”. Battle

title: TEAM TACTICS – NZ QUICK UP
instructions:
Forwards along boards at blue line, Defence along boards on
    same side at opposite blue line; 1st forward skates towards D, D jumps out to NZ, transitions
    backwards and picks up a puck that is spotted by the coach.; D makes a quick up pass along the wall to first forward who
    goes in for shot on net. 2nd forward jumps out and the same
    sequence occurs except quick up pass is to the middle.; D follows second pass up ice and stops inside the blue line,
    first forward leaves net front to retrieve puck out of corner,
    passes to D and goes back to net front for tip or rebound on
    shot from D.
teaching_points: Control skate to be good option for D
D find puck and make good first pass to forward
Shoot to score

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – RETRIEVAL - 1 ON 1
instructions:
Defence start in centre of ice at blue line, fwds in centre
    circle; Coach dumps puck ( can be deep or shallow ), D retrieves and
    tries to skate it out of zone, fwd forechecks to try and create
    turnover; If turnover occurs, play the 1 on 1 as if in a game situation
teaching_points:
D get back to puck quickly, shoulder check, fake, quick feet
    to skate puck out of zone
Fwd forecheck hard, good angle and stick position

title: TEAM TACTICS – NZ RETRIEVAL WITH SUPPORT
instructions:
Forwards on boards at blue line, D in the centre circle; On coaches’ signal, D backpeddle to pick up a puck spotted
    by coach in the NZ; At same time forward skates towards far blue line and control
    skates through neutral zone to opposite side of ice to
    get a pass from the D.; Forward goes in for shot, stops at net after the shot. D
    follows the play up ice inside the blue line.; After first shot, forward sprints to corner to get puck and
    passes to D who can return the pass or shoot on net. Fwd
    goes for tip or rebound
teaching_points: Control skate to be good option for D
D find puck and make good first pass to forward
Shoot to score

title: WARM UP – 5 SHOT - PUCK SUPPORT WARM UP
instructions:
Defence inside blue line, Forwards along boards in neutral
    zone with pucks; On whistle, 3 forwards jump into neutral zone with pucks
    and perform random stickhandling moves – must stay
    between red line and blue line.; 3 forwards can pass to either Defence – Defence have to keep
    their feet moving – they can escape, tight turn or transition
    with puck before passing back to the forward; Forwards have to make sure only 1 person passes to a D at a
    time; On next whistle, forwards each go in for a shot making sure
    goalie has time to get for 2nd and 3rd shots. D skate up to
    neutral zone to get a puck a finish with a shot.
teaching_points:
Forwards – heads up stickhandling, communication before
    passing to D

Defence keep feet moving constantly, present stick as target
    for pass

title: WARM UP – 5 SHOT WARM UP
instructions:
Forwards in opposite ends and opposite corners; Defence in the centre ice circle; Pucks on the boards at the hash marks on the opposite side
    of where forwards start; On whistle, 2 – 3 forwards leave the corner with the puck
    and skate into neutral zone, around centre ice circle – Keep
    feet moving the entire time. First shot comes from right
    side, 2nd shot from middle, 3rd shot from left side.; Once forwards skate past the Defence, 2 of them skate backwards
    around the circle and enter the zone, stopping just
    inside the blue line. Coach passes to near D who then goes D
    to D with pass for first shot, coach then passes to far D who
    passes D to D for second shot.; Forwards stop at net after shot and look for tips or rebounds
    – do not screen goalie as this is a warm up drill
teaching_points: Feet always moving, no gliding
Shoot in stride, stop at net after shot
D heads up shooting

title: WARM UP – PUCK SUPPORT - WARM UP
instructions: Transition drill while puck handling; D pass, open pivot and receive puck back; D then pivots and steps up and passes; D continues receives a pass steps up and passes; D then open pivots receives pass and attacks the net
teaching_points: Quick feet and always face the puck
Present your stick for passes
Keep the puck on the fore-hand and pass it hard
Good transitions and pivots

forward to backward and backward
    to forward

title: WARM UP – SKATE PASS SHOOT - WARM UP
instructions:
Players in each corner with puck, coach’s at the centre ice
    red line along the boards; On coaches’ signal, 3 players leave corner, transition skate
    around the dot and skate towards blue line, making a pass to
    the coach on the boards.; After making the pass, skate into the neutral zone and
    receive a pass from the coach on the opposite side and go in
    for shot on net; Opposite corner then goes
teaching_points: Quick feet, head up on pass
Present stick as target for return pass
Shoot on stride, shoot to score

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – TEAM WARM UP WITH GOALIES
instructions: Incorporating goalies into team warm-ups; Goalies to do their skating patterns after the players; C-cuts; T-pushes; Shuffles; Butterfly Slides; Powerslides
teaching_points: Don’t rush

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – T-PUSHES FORWARD AND BACKWARD
instructions: Eyes first, gloves are leading; Strong stops

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – SHUFFLE AND HALF-CIRCLE C-CUT ON THE LINE
instructions:
Stable head and shoulders, stay low; Non C-cut skate should stay on the line and just change
    forward/backward position

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – SCREEN FOOTWORK
instructions:
Set 3 pucks in front of goalie in a triangle to show 3
    different lanes; Goalie to shuffle between each pucks; Practice looking over and around screens (with or without
    a player screen)
teaching_points: Strong shuffles
Increase range of mobility around screen

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – POWERSLIDES FORWARD AND BACKWARD LADDER
instructions:
Goalies perform the following skating technique in a
    straight line where ice is available; 3 pushes each way
teaching_points: Eyes first, gloves leading and in position

Controlled upper body: gloves, head and shoulders are
    steady
Controlled and fluid edges

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – PIVOT BACKWARD BUTTERFLY SLIDES ON THE LINE
instructions:
Eyes first, gloves leading and in position; Controlled upper body: gloves, head and shoulders are
    steady; Pivot, push both feet across the line, controlled stop

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – PIVOT AND LONG SHUFFLE ALONG THE LINE
instructions: Goalies perform a pivot and long shuffle along a line; Get both skates across the line; Use the line as a reference point
teaching_points: Pivot body and transfer weight
Toes pointed square to imaginary puck
Pivot eyes first and lead with gloves
Stable head and shoulders should pivot with eyes

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – PARTNER CIRCLE SHUFFLES
instructions:
Goalies perform various shuffles around the circles with a
    partner; Alternating sides to get both right and left skate
teaching_points:
Head and shoulders remain at the same height and are
    stable
Motion is all from the hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down

Take the weight off the lead skate, shouldn’t move and
    stay stable

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – PARTNER CIRCLE C-CUTS
instructions:
Goalies start at hash marks at the same time and perform
    one-leg C-cuts; Forwards until opposite hash marks and then backwards; Goalies switch sides so they do both right and left skate
teaching_points: Head remains at the same height
Motion all from hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down
Outside skate does all the work

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – LONG C-CUTS WITH STOP
instructions:
Goalie performs the following skating pattern where ice
    is available
teaching_points:
All about edge control: not a hard stop, control edge and
    stop at an increasing rate
Lean forward and bend knees for balance and control

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – LATERAL POWERSLIDES
instructions:
Goalies perform the following skating technique laterally
    where ice is available; 3 pushes right, 1 push left, 3 pushes right, 1 push left, etc.; Vice versa
teaching_points:
Controlled upper body: gloves in position, shoulders and
    head steady

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – HALF CIRCLE C-CUTS ALONG THE LINE
instructions:
Goalie performs one leg C-cuts along the line; One skate at a time forwards and backwards staying on
    the line
teaching_points: Stable head and shoulders

Non C-cut skate should stay on the line and just change
    forward/backward position

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – FORWARD T-PUSH AND SHUFFLE ALONG THE LINE
instructions:
Goalies perform a forward T-push and shuffle back to the
    line; Use the line as a reference point
teaching_points: Eyes look first and lead with gloves
Stable head and shoulders
Strong pushes and stops

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – FIGURE 8 HEEL TO HEEL
instructions:
Goalies perform a figure 8 around 2 pucks going heel to
    heel around the pucks; Use the momentum of initial push to skate around the
    puck; Lean in and control balance
teaching_points:
Head should be right above the puck, working on balance
    and control
Use momentum of turns
Lean in for balance and control
Upper body should be stable

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING - CIRCLE FIGURE 8 C-CUTS
instructions:
Goalies perform one-leg and alternating C-cuts around
    the face-off circles; Forwards and backwards; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on
    what is available
teaching_points: Head remains stable and at the same height
Motion all from hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down
Outside skate does the work around circles

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – CIRCLE CONDITIONING
instructions:
Starting at the hash marks, goalies does a skating
    technique, sprints to other side and repeats; The following techniques are:3 C-cuts out and 2 C-cuts back3 shuffles out and backButterfly and powerslides out and backPad stack each way3 poke checks; 3 C-cuts out and 2 C-cuts back; 3 shuffles out and back; Butterfly and powerslides out and back; Pad stack each way; 3 poke checks
teaching_points: 3 C-cuts out and 2 C-cuts back
3 shuffles out and back
Butterfly and powerslides out and back
Pad stack each way
3 poke checks

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – C-CUTS ONE LEG
instructions: Goalies perform one-leg C-cuts in a straight line; Forwards and backwards: weight on the heels of the skate for forwards motion and toes of the skate for backwards motion; Right and left skate; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on what is available
teaching_points: Head and shoulders remain at the same height and are stable
Motion is all from the hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – C-CUTS LONG STRIDES
instructions:
Goalies perform long stride C-cuts in a straight line; Forwards and backwards: weight on the heels of the skate
    for forwards motion and toes of the skate for backwards
    motion; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on
    what is available
teaching_points: Head is stable and remains at the same height
Motion all from hips down

Stick stays in the middle as skates are transitioning from
    one to another
Working on inside edges of the skates

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – C-CUTS
instructions:
Goalies perform double C-cuts (Periscope) in a straight line; Forwards and backwards: weight on the heels of the skate
    for forwards motion and toes of the skate for backwards
    motion; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on what
    is available
teaching_points:
Head and shoulders remain at the same height and are
    stable
Motion is all from the hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – C-CUTS ALTERNATING
instructions:
Goalies perform alternating C-cuts in a straight line; Forwards and backwards: weight on the heels of the skate
    for forwards motion and toes of the skate for backwards
    motion; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on
    what is available
teaching_points:
Head and shoulders remain at the same height and are
    stable
Motion is all from the hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – BUTTERFLY SLIDE FORWARD AND PIVOT BACKWARD
instructions:
Goalies perform the following skating technique in a
    straight line where ice is available
teaching_points: Eyes first
Pivot, push and controlled stop
Gloves leading and in position

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – BUTTERFLY RECOVERY FORWARD AND BACKWARD
instructions:
Goalies perform the following skating technique in a
    straight line where ice is available
teaching_points: Eyes first, rotate, load leg
Gloves leading and in position

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – 5 PUCK CROSS C-CUTS
instructions:
Goalies perform one-leg and alternating C-cuts around
    the pucks doing figure 8s; Forwards and backwards; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on
    what is available
teaching_points: Head remains stable and at the same height
Motion all from hips down
Stick on the ice, eyes and chin down
Outside skate does the work around the pucks

title: GOALTENDING – SKATING – 3 FORWARD AND 2 BACK C-CUTS
instructions:
Goalies perform this C-cut pattern in a straight line; 3 C-cuts forward, stop, 2 C-cuts backward, stop, etc.; Can be done in different spots of the ice, depending on
    what is available
teaching_points: Use stop to generate power to go forward and backward
Load leg at stops to get power
Hard C-cuts and stops

title: GOALTENDING – SCREENS – POINT SHOT SCREENS
instructions:
Player at the point with pucks; Another player screening the goalie in front of the net; Player takes a shot starting with short side; Goalie starts behind the screen and then tries to beat the
    screen and make the save; Repeat with far side shots and repeat at other angles
teaching_points: Goalie’s body should be in the same angle as the puck

Ideally find the puck short side or over the shoulder
    (short side) if the player is on angle also. If not, it is more
    important to find the puck

title: GOALTENDING – SCREENS – LOW TO HIGH PASS WITH SHOTS AND BACKDOOR
instructions:
One player on the goal line with pucks, two players at the
    top of the circles and a screener 3 shots:Goal line player passes straight out to player who
        takes a shotGoal line player passes straight out to player who
        passes again East-West then a shotGoal line player passes straight out to player who tries
        to go backdoor to the other player skating inGoalie starts at post every time, players need to wait for
        goalie to recover to post; Goal line player passes straight out to player who
        takes a shot; Goal line player passes straight out to player who
        passes again East-West then a shot; Goal line player passes straight out to player who tries
        to go backdoor to the other player skating in; Goalie starts at post every time, players need to wait for
        goalie to recover to post
teaching_points:
Goal line player passes straight out to player who
        takes a shot

Goal line player passes straight out to player who
        passes again East-West then a shot

Goal line player passes straight out to player who tries
        to go backdoor to the other player skating in

Goalie starts at post every time, players need to wait for
        goalie to recover to post

title: GOALTENDING – SCREENS – EAST/WEST PASS WITH A SCREEN
instructions:
Two players at the top of the circles, one player in front of
    the goalie screening; One players passes to the screener for a tap back and then
    passes to the other player at the top of the circles; Player takes a shot; Play the rebound; Repeat at opposite side
teaching_points: Goalie’s body should be in the same angle as the puck

Ideally find the puck short side or over the shoulder
    (short side) if the player is on angle also. If not, it is more
    important to find the puck

title: GOALTENDING – REBOUNDS – SLOT SCRAMBLE REBOUND
instructions:
Player in the slot with pucks and two players around on
    stand by; Net face down on an angle in front of the crease; Player with pucks takes a shot in the netting; All players play the puck; Goalie needs to follow the shot as if it is a pass and react
    to the scramble
teaching_points: Eyes first, track the puck
Find the puck
Goalie should be coming in the net on an angle

title: GOALTENDING – REBOUNDS – REBOUND RECOVERY MIDDLE TO SIDE
instructions:
One player in the slot with pucks and another player at
    the face-off dot with pucks; Player in the slot takes a shot low stick side to where the
    other player is; Goalie saves first shot and finds second puck at the faceoff
    dot for another shot; Player at the face-off dot takes the shot when goalie is in
    movement; Repeat opposite side
teaching_points: Side to middle
Side to side

title: GOALTENDING – REBOUNDS – IN TIGHT PAD REBOUND
instructions:
Players in the slot with pucks and one puck placed at each
    side of goalie just outside the crease; One player facing the goalie and another player behind
    with a puck; Player with a puck shoots along the ice on either side of
    goalie; Player facing the goalie reacts and plays the puck on the
    side the goalie made the initial save; Goalie needs to powerslide to second puck for the save
teaching_points: Close up the 5 hole

Blocking hands (glove and blocker in tight along the
    body)
Position should not allow anything under or through

title: GOALTENDING – REBOUNDS – FAR REBOUND RECOVERY
instructions:
Two players at each side of the crease with a puck; One player in the high slot with pucks who takes the first
    shot along the ice blocker or glove side; Whichever side the puck is redirected, the player closer to
    the crease plays their puck; Goalie to make the butterfly save and powerslide over
teaching_points: Eyes first
Close up the 5 hole

Blocking hands (glove and blocker in tight along the
    body) = Position should not allow anything under or
    through

Come back to net for the rebound on an angle, don’t chase
    the rebound

title: GOALTENDING – REBOUNDS – CROSS CREASE REBOUND
instructions:
Goalie starts in a butterfly position square to the face-off
    dot, puck placed by his inside pad; Player in front of the net and another player at the
    opposite face-off dot; On coach’s GO, player in front of the net slightly passes
    the puck to player skating in for the rebound; Goalie powerslides for the save; Drill is used to recreate a tight rebound situation and a
    goalie’s rebound recovery
teaching_points: Eyes first, find the puck and track its movement
Position should not allow anything under or through

title: GOALTENDING – PUCKHANDLING – DUMP IN ON NET PUCKHANDLING
instructions:
Coach in the high slot with pucks; Shoots at the goalie to catch, place on ice and pass back; Lightly dumps the puck on net for the goalie to handle
    and pass back; Dumps a little away from the net for the goalie to handle
    and pass back; Dumps further away from the net for the goalie to handle
    and pass back
teaching_points: Place puck face down on ice to pass easier
Look before pass

title: GOALTENDING – NET DRIVES – BAD ANGLE POST WORK: VERTICAL HORIZONTAL
instructions:
One forward to drive the net on a bad angle and shoot; Defence in position to allow the shot and deny a pass; Goalie to recognize the situation where the player is
    choosing to shoot
teaching_points:
Recognize where the D is – taking away the pass and
    forcing a shot

Establish VH when player is shooting – goalie must find
    their timing and practice improving quickness of VH

title: GOALTENDING – NET DRIVES – BAD ANGLE POST WORK: OVERLAP
instructions:
One forward to drive the net on a bad angle and shoot; Defence in position to allow the shot and deny a pass; Goalie to recognize the situation where the player is
    choosing to shoot
teaching_points:
Recognize where the D is – taking away the pass and
    forcing a shot
Establish overlap when recognizing player’s depth
Ready and set to receive

title: GOALTENDING – NET DRIVES – BAD ANGLE POST WORK: REVERSE VERTICAL HORIZONTAL
instructions:
One forward to drive the net on a bad angle and beat the
    defence; Goalie to recognize the situation where the player is
    beating the defenceman
teaching_points:
Recognize when player is driving the net – goalie should
    seal the ice

Goalie must find their timing and practice improving
    quickness of RVH

title: GOALTENDING – KARAOKE CROSSOVERS
instructions:
Goalies perform the following skating technique in front
    of pucks lined up; Where ice is available; Forward crossovers, backward crossovers, forward and
    backwards; Each leg
teaching_points: Work on control and balance
Increase range of mobility

title: GOALTENDING – HIGH / LOW – LOW TO HIGH PASSOUT
instructions:
One player at the goal line with pucks and another player
    receiving around the slot in different positions; Goalie to play the passout
teaching_points:
Skate push until the puck is almost received –
    establishing maximum depth

Recognize the situationWhen passer cannot drive the net: feet are set at
        maximum depth

When passer cannot drive the net: feet are set at
        maximum depth
Goalie needs to move to the middle then out

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – VISUALIZATION
instructions: Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Goalie visualizes a glove or blocker save; Then shot is placed when the goalie visualized the save; Repeat
teaching_points: Visualize good habits

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – STICK DEFLECTION INTO NETS
instructions: Goalie in a butterfly with nets at each side; Player to shoot along the ice blocker and glove side; Goalie to deflect into the nets
teaching_points: Controlling the shot and deflecting into the nets
Stick on an angle for easier control

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – ON KNEES SHOTS GLOVE IN BUTTERFLY
instructions: Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes 3 glove shots on the goalie in net: in a butterfly; Repeat
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready
Eyes are tracking the puck all the way into glove
Stick in the middle

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – ON KNEES SHOTS BLOCKER IN BUTTERFLY
instructions: Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes 3 blocker shots on the goalie in net: in a butterfly; Repeat
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready

Eyes are tracking the puck all the way to blocker and
    rebound
Let the puck come to the blocker, do not reach for puck
Rotate blocker slightly to deflect
Stick in the middle, on the same blocker angle

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – HIGH GLOVE SHOTS IN BUTTERFLY
instructions:
Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes high glove shots at the goalie in net when they are
    in a butterfly
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready
Eyes are tracking the puck all the way into the glove

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – HAND EYE WITH BALL
instructions:
Goalie with preferably basketball between hands; Coach or player takes glove or blocker shots for goalie to
    trap or deflect
teaching_points: Increase quickness of gloves
Practice gloves being out and in front

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – GLOVE SHOTS STANDING, DOWN AND IN BUTTERFLY
instructions:
Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes 3 glove shots on the goalie in net: standing, going
    into a butterfly, and in a butterfly; Repeat
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready
Eyes are tracking the puck all the way into glove
Stick in the middle

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – FINLAND SHOOTING
instructions:
Two cones set up a few feet apart; Goalie does the following movement between the cones
    while receiving glove shots:ShufflePowerslide; Shuffle; Powerslide; Two players in front of goalie to alternate shooting at
    glove and blocker
teaching_points: Shuffle
Powerslide

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – EAST/WEST T-PUSH
instructions:
Players at each face-off dots with pucks; Goalie starts square to a face-off dot, pivot and T-pushes
    for a shot at opposite face-off dot; Starts again on feet, square to the face-off dot and
    repeats motion; Shooters are trying to hit the middle bar when aiming and
    shoot when coming across
teaching_points:
Eyes are tracking the puck all the way from start to
    rebound
Eyes pivot first, shoulders pivot and feet follow
Controlled movements, practice moving hands
Moving back towards the post to be square to the puck

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – EAST/WEST BUTTERFLY SLIDES
instructions:
Players at each face-off dots with pucks; Goalie starts square to a face-off dot, pivot and butterfly
    slides for a shot at opposite face-off dot; Starts again on feet, square to the face-off dot and
    repeats motion; Shooters are trying to hit the middle bar when aiming and
    shoot when coming across
teaching_points:
Eyes are tracking the puck all the way from start to
    rebound
Eyes pivot first, shoulders pivot and feet follow
Controlled movements, practice moving hands
Moving back towards the post to be square to the puck

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – CLEAR GLOVE SHOTS IN BUTTERFLY
instructions: Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes glove shots on the goalie in net
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready
Eyes are tracking the puck all the way into glove
Place the puck directly on the ice after save

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – CLEAR BLOCKER SHOTS IN BUTTERFLY
instructions: Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes blocker shots on the goalie in net; Control rebound and deflect into corners
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready

Eyes are tracking the puck all the way to blocker and
    rebound
Let the puck come to the blocker, do not reach for puck
Rotate blocker slightly to deflect

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – BLOCKER SHOTS STANDING, DOWN AND IN BUTTERFLY
instructions:
Player or coach at the top of the circles with pucks; Takes 3 blocker shots on the goalie in net: standing,
    going into a butterfly, and in a butterfly; Repeat
teaching_points: Hands are out and ready

Eyes are tracking the puck all the way to blocker and
    rebound
Let the puck come to the blocker, do not reach for puck
Rotate blocker slightly to deflect
Stick in the middle, on the same blocker angle

title: GOALTENDING – HANDS – BACKWARD C-CUTS
instructions:
Goalie starts on the goal line in the net; C-cuts to the top of the crease, stops, and C-cuts
    backwards; Player is in the slot with pucks and shoots towards the
    goalie’s glove and blocker when they start moving back; Right foot stop with right hand save, left foot stop with
    left hand save
teaching_points:
Head and shoulders stable and continuously at the same
    height

Stick on the ice, in the middle on an angle where the
    blocker falls
Hard stops

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 3 VS 2 EAST WEST PASS SIDE TO SIDE
instructions:
Two defencemen and three forwards to simulate an entry
    with 3 vs 2 where the puck carrier passes; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Establish maximum depth early

Motion back because outnumbered and to help move to
    the new angle
Angle back towards the net, don’t chase the pass
Set early, ready to receive position

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 3 VS 2 EAST WEST PASS SIDE TO MIDDLE
instructions:
Two defencemen and three forwards to simulate an entry
    with 3 vs 2 where the puck carrier passes; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Read what the D is taking away
Motion back to respect the pass – helps move to a new angle

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 3 VS 2 EAST WEST CARRY
instructions:
Two defencemen and three forwards to simulate an entry
    with 3 vs 2 where the puck carrier carries the puck and
    shoots; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Establish maximum depth early

Motion back because outnumbered and to help move to
    the new angle

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 3 VS 2 CLEAR SHOT
instructions:
Two defencemen and three forwards to simulate an entry
    with 3 vs 2 where the puck carrier shoots; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Read what the D is taking away

If there is no option to pass or get to the net: hold
    position
Motion back because out numbered
Establish maximum depth early

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 2 VS 2 CLEAR SHOT
instructions:
Two defencemen and two forwards to simulate an entry
    with 2 vs 2 where the puck carrier shoots; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Read what the D is taking away
If there is no option to pass: hold position
Motion back if pass option drives the middle

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 2 VS 1 EAST WEST PASS
instructions:
One defenceman and two forwards to simulate an entry
    with 2 vs 1 where the puck carrier passes; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Read what the D is taking away
If there is an option to pass: motion back to respect it
Eyes and chin down, eyes first to track the pass
Angle back towards the net, don’t chase the pass

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 2 VS 1 CLEAR SHOT
instructions:
One defenceman and two forwards to simulate an entry
    with 2 vs 1 where the puck carrier shoots; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Read what the D is taking away
Establish position and depth early
Hold position when shooting from outside the dot
Motion back if coming inside the dots

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 1 VS 1 EAST WEST CARRY
instructions:
One defenceman and one forward to simulate an entry
    with 1 vs 1 where the attacker carries the puck East / West
    and takes a shot; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Establish position and depth early
Speed of backwards motion = speed of attacker

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 1 VS 1 DOWN THE WING WITH GOOD DEFENCE
instructions:
One defenceman and one forward to simulate an entry
    with 1 vs 1 where the attacker can’t beat the defence but
    takes a shot; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Establish position and depth early
Hold position when shooting from outside the dot
Recognize no opportunity of a net drive

title: GOALTENDING – ENTRIES – 1 VS 1 DOWN THE WING WITH BAD DEFENCE
instructions:
One defenceman and one forward to simulate an entry
    with 1 vs 1 where the attacker beats the defence; Goaltender to recognize how to play this situation
teaching_points: Establish position and depth early
Hold position when shooting from outside the dot
Backward motion when D gets beat,Helps with the change of angle if player drives the netHold position if player decides to shoot
Helps with the change of angle if player drives the net
Hold position if player decides to shoot

title: GOALTENDING – EAST / WEST – TOP OF THE CIRCLES PASS
instructions: Players at each top of the circle with pucks; Players to pass and take a one-timer or receive and shoot
teaching_points:
Goalie can either T-push or shuffle depending on skill:Shuffle is more efficient and allows goalie to
        always be on angle

Shuffle is more efficient and allows goalie to
        always be on angle
Angle back to net, don’t chase the pass

title: GOALTENDING – DEFLECTIONS – MIDDLE LANE TIPS
instructions:
One player inside the blue line with pucks and one player
    tipping in front of the net; Player should shoot outside the skates and tipper to make
    the puck come back inside with the tip; Play the rebound
teaching_points: Goalie to butterfly with a slight movement left or right
Don’t over push, the puck will come back to the middle
Follow the rebound

title: GOALTENDING – DEFLECTIONS – HIGH TO LOW BACKDOOR DEFLECTION
instructions:
Player at the top of one circle with pucks, another player
    just inside the blue line ready to skate backdoor; Player with pucks does a hard pass for backdoor tip
teaching_points:
Need slight motion backwards for oncoming player and a
    pivot to new angle
Need to see if the tipper is left of right handed
Track puck and rebound
Don’t over play

title: GOALTENDING – DEFLECTIONS – HIGH SKATING DEFLECTION
instructions:
Player at the top of one circle with pucks, another player
    just inside the blue line ready to skate into the slot; Player with pucks does a hard pass for a tip in the slot
teaching_points: Need slight motion backwards for oncoming player
Need to see if the tipper is left of right handed
Track puck and rebound

title: GOALTENDING – CLEAR SHOTS – LOW TO HIGH SHOT
instructions:
One player on the goal line with pucks; Passes to a player right inside the blue line who takes a
    shot before the top of the circles; Goalie starts at the post, follows the pass; Play the rebound; Repeat opposite side
teaching_points: Goalie needs to beat the pass
Get set outside the crease to maximize depth
Hold position because player can only shoot

title: GOALTENDING – CLEAR SHOTS – EAST WEST SHOT
instructions:
One players passes East-West to the other player just
    inside the blue line; Player takes a shot before the top of the circles; Everyone plays the rebound; Repeat other side
teaching_points: Strong T-push to maximize depth and beat the pass
Get set and hold position for the shot

title: GOALTENDING – CLEAR SHOT – ENTRY HOLD
instructions: Players lined up around the Neutral Zone face-off; Enter the zone and take a shot before the top of the circles; Play the rebound; Repeat opposite side
teaching_points: Goalie needs to be set for the shot
Establish and hold position when player can only shoot

title: GOALTENDING – BREAKAWAYS – BREAKAWAY WITH A SHOT
instructions: Players in the NZ and come in on a breakaway
teaching_points: Establish depth
Speed of backwards motion = speed of attacker

title: GOALTENDING – BREAKAWAYS – BREAKAWAY WITH A DEKE
instructions: Players in the NZ and come in on a breakaway
teaching_points: Establish depth
Speed of backwards motion = speed of attacker

title: U11 - SKATING – WARM UP
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and then back along the boards.; Perform each skating skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: U11 - SKATING – WARM UP – BACKWARDS
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards.; Perform each backward skating skill as shown.
