teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL WARM UP
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards.; Perform each skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up set up – have players try to get as many reps of each skill as possible down the ice
Encourage quick hands and lots of range of motion

title: U11 - SKATING – EDGE CONTROL
instructions: Coaches place two hockey sticks perpendicular to each other inside a faceoff circle; Players skate a figure 8 pattern around the sticks, focusing on riding the inside edge of each skate around the turns; Progress to heel-to-heel around the sticks; Both directions
teaching_points: Players should focus on good knee bend and controlling their balance on the inside edge of their skates
Encourage players to keep their head up

title: U11 - SKATING – EDGE CONTROL – PUCK DOTS
instructions: Place 5 pucks in a row down the middle of the faceoff circle; Players weave back and forth through the pucks working on one foot stops on each side of the pucks.; Progression: Outside edge, inside edge, backwards.
teaching_points: Emphasize holding balance on one foot through each stop.

title: U11 - GOALTENDING – SKATING – PUCK DOTS
instructions: Place 5 pucks in a row down the middle of the faceoff circle; Goalies weave back and forth through the pucks, stopping on each side and dropping into butterfly; Progression: Butterfly slide through pucks
teaching_points: Goalies should focus on staying square and facing up ice.
Work on quickness and proper butterfly technique.

title: U11 - SKATING – EDGE CONTROL – CROSSUNDER
instructions: Place pucks around the outside of the faceoff circle; Players skate around the circle performing a “crossunder”; Progression: place two sticks in a straight line and hold the crossunder over the sticks
teaching_points: Encourage players to get a strong push from their back foot when crossing under for acceleration
Get players comfortable holding the crossunder position and riding their edges

title: U11 - SKATING – LATERAL AGILITY
instructions: On the whistle, players perform lateral crossovers back and forth across the length of the faceoff circle.
teaching_points: Emphasize keeping your feet up ice and staying square.
Work on quick feet and moving laterally as fast as possible with good technique

title: U11 - GOALTENDING – SKATING – CIRCLE AGILITY
instructions: On the whistle, goalies perform standing lateral pushes back and forth across the length of the faceoff circle.
teaching_points: Goalies should focus on balancing on one foot when stopping and changing direction.
Work on quick feet and moving laterally as fast as possible with good technique.

title: U11 - SKATING – CIRCLE CROSSOVER PROGRESSION
instructions: On the whistle, players skate around the faceoff circle performing the crossover progression.; Players start with single leg pushes around the circle and then progress to performing slow crossovers around the circle; Perform both directions and then switch to backwards
teaching_points: Focus on keeping your shoulders square
Perform large crossovers that grab lots of ice and maximize efficiency
Slow, good technique.

title: U11 - GOALTENDING – SKATING – CIRCLE SKATING
instructions: Goalies perform backwards standing single leg pushes around the faceoff circle.; Progression: Two goalies perform backwards standing single leg pushes around ½ the faceoff circle, then perform lateral butterfly pushes across the length of the circle before completing standing single leg pushes around the other ½ of the circle.
teaching_points: Focus on keeping shoulders square.
Emphasize good technique before quickness.

title: SKATING – WARM UP – SPEED PROGRESSION
instructions: Players lineup at one end of the ice and perform various skills down the center of the ice.; Perform progressions to maximize speed and power.
teaching_points: Ride inside edge each direction
Two foot turns
One crossover
Two crossovers
One crossover, ride inside edge
Full speed, any technique

title: PUCK CONTROL – WARM UP
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards.; Perform each skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up set up – have players try to get as many reps of each skill as possible down the ice
Encourage quick hands and lots of range of motion

title: DEFENCE – LOOSE PUCK RETRIEVALS
instructions: Defensive player uses deception on puck retrieval to deceive the fore-checker; Defensive player approaches puck from a variety on angle to deceive F1; Defense will self-feed a puck and make a deceptive move before they touch the puck. Both faking net wheel then up and faking up and then turning toward the net need to be practiced
teaching_points: Defensive players need to shoulder check, decide what they will do then approach the loose puck at an angle to deceive F1
Turning the toes, leaning and “selling” a deceptive move will create time and space for the breakout
It is important to give the fore-checker time to react to your move

title: DEFENCE – LOOSE PUCK RETRIEVALS - #2
instructions: Defensive player uses deception on puck retrieval to deceive the fore-checker; Defensive player approaches puck from a variety on angle to deceive F1; Coaches will feed a puck and players need to make a deceptive move before they touch the puck. Both faking net wheel then up and faking up and then turning toward the net need to be practiced; Add a forechecker with passive resistance for a game like scenario
teaching_points: Defensive players need to shoulder check, decide what they will do then approach the loose puck at an angle to deceive F1
Turning the toes, leaning and “selling” a deceptive move will create time and space for the breakout
It is important to give the fore-checker time to react to your move

title: DEFENCE – RETRIEVAL – WHEEL - PASS MIDDLE
instructions: Defensive player uses deception on puck retrieval to deceive the fore-checker; Defensive player approaches puck from a variety on angle to deceive F1; Defensive player will make a deceptive move before touching the puck. Player will fake a quick up, wheel the net and pass to front of line
teaching_points: Defensive players need to shoulder check, decide what they will do then approach the loose puck at an angle to deceive F1
Turning the toes, leaning and “selling” a deceptive move will create time and space for the breakout
It is important to give the fore-checker time to react to your move
Players will fake a quick up and wheel the net passing to the front of the line
If no pressure, defensive player will keep the puck on their forehand when wheeling the net

title: DEFENCE – RETRIEVALS – INSIDE - OUTSIDE
instructions: Defensive player uses deception on puck retrieval to deceive the fore-checker; Defensive player approaches puck from a variety on angle to deceive F1; Defensive player will make a deceptive move before touching the puck. Player will fake a quick up and turn inside and the second repetition will fake wheel and will quick up
teaching_points: Defensive players need to shoulder check, decide what they will do then approach the loose puck at an angle to deceive F1
Turning the toes, leaning and “selling” a deceptive move will create time and space for the breakout
It is important to give the fore-checker time to react to your move
Players will go twice faking each way once

title: DEFENCE – RETRIEVALS – WHEEL WITH SHOT
instructions: Defensive player uses deception on puck retrieval to deceive the fore-checker; Defensive player approaches puck from a variety on angle to deceive F1; Defensive player will make a deceptive move before touching the puck. Player will fake a quick up, wheel the net and pass to front of line; D at blue line will shoot the puck
teaching_points: Defensive players need to shoulder check, decide what they will do then approach the loose puck at an angle to deceive F1
Turning the toes, leaning and “selling” a deceptive move will create time and space for the breakout
It is important to give the fore-checker time to react to your move
Players will fake a quick up and wheel the net passing to the front of the line. Defensemen on the blue line should use good shooting options to get the puck to the net
If no pressure, defensive player will keep the puck on their forehand when wheeling the net

title: DEFENCE – SKATING – TRANSITION SEQUENCE
instructions: Players start with toes up ice around the circle. Players will do 2 “toes first” transitions followed by two “heels and hips” transition going from forward to backwards. All backwards to forward pivots should be without crossing the feet; Coaches can send two players at once and could also send one from each side.
teaching_points: Good warmup for defenseman to practice transition pivot options
Defensive players try to keep their speed and limit crossing their feet
“Heels and hips” will require one cross over
Good transition skating principles apply

title: DEFENSE - SHOOTING – 3 SHOT SEQUENCE FROM POINT
instructions: Defenseman will take 3 shoots: one pulling and shooting, a one timer and a spin and shoot; Defensemen will be on their strong side and will alternate side to side
teaching_points: Defensemen must keep their head up and use peripheral vision
Get as close to the blue line as possible.
Use good basic shooting techniques on these options
Once mastered, defenseman can start to use deceptive moves before shooting

title: DEFENCE – SHOOTING - STOP AND SHOOT
instructions: Defensemen will stop the puck, turn and immediately shoot on net; Quick release with head up is key
teaching_points: Receive the puck, circle it and shoot as quickly as possible anticipating you have a lane to the net
Head up and hit the net

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION SEQUENCE
instructions: Place two pucks at the top of the faceoff circle. On the whistle, players leave the corner and skate around one of the pucks, protecting the puck back down the side of the circle.; Complete both directions before taking a shot on net.; Progression: Add a defender
teaching_points: Use one hand to keep the puck out wide in order to protect from defenders.
Emphasize keeping your feet moving by using single leg heel pushes for acceleration.

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION SEQUENCE #2
instructions: Place two pucks at the top of the faceoff circle. On the whistle, players leave the corner carrying a puck and skate through the pucks before performing a turn back and protecting the puck back down the center of the circle. Perform both directions before taking a shot on net.; Progression: Add a defender
teaching_points: Use one hand to keep the puck out wide in order to protect from defenders.
Emphasize keeping your feet moving by using single leg heel pushes for acceleration.

title: PUCK CONTROL – CIRCLE AGILITY STICKS
instructions: Place two ‘danglers’ perpendicular to each other inside the faceoff circle.; On the whistle, players leave the corner with a puck skating around the danglers in a figure 8 pattern working on different skills.
teaching_points: Forehand only
Forehand only – under stick
Forehand only – heel to heel
Forehand only – heel to heel – under stick
Random Moves

title: PUCK CONTROL – AGILITY STICKS #2
instructions: Place two ‘danglers’ parallel to each other inside the faceoff circle.; On the whistle, players leave the corner with a puck skating around the danglers in a figure 8 pattern working on different skills.
teaching_points: Puck under stick
Eberle Move – Pull back on backhand
Puck over stick

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION - PUCK UNDER STICK
instructions: On the whistle two players skate around the faceoff circle, a puck carrier and a defender. The puck carrier tries to protect the puck from the defender while trying to make moves under the stick of the defender.
teaching_points: Use your body to protect the puck from the defender
Create space by making deceptive moves through the defenders triangle.
Be creative and unpredictable

title: SHOOTING – SHOOTING SEQUENCE
instructions: Players line up in two lines just outside of the blue line. Place two obstacles above the hash marks in the slot.; Players alternate skating towards the obstacles and performing a shooting skill.
teaching_points: Change angle – quick pull/toe drag - wrist shot
Pull to backhand – shot
Eberle move
Cross lanes – Wrist shot

title: SHOOTING – FAKE PASS – OFF WING SHOT
instructions: Players line up in two lines just outside of the blue line. Place two obstacles above the hash marks in the slot.; Players alternate crossing lanes, faking a pass across, and shooting the puck.
teaching_points: Emphasize looking pass before taking the shot for deception.

title: SHOOTING – OFF WING – 1 KNEE DOWN
instructions: Players line up in two lines just outside of the blue line. Place two obstacles above the hash marks in the slot.; Two players leave at the same time and cross lanes. The puck carrier will pass across and set up the second player for a 1 knee down one-timer.
teaching_points: Use the 1 Knee Down technique to maximize power from your shot.
Focus on picking a corner

title: SCORING – INSIDE EDGE WRAPAROUND
instructions: Players line up in two lines outside of the blue line. On the whistle, players alternate skating around the net and perform a wraparound.
teaching_points: Players focus on riding their inside edge while performing the wraparound.

title: DEFENCE – BREAKOUT - NET FRONT PASS
instructions: D cross and take a onetime shot, tag up at blue line and initiate breakout.; D-D to wing and back to net front D; Used when a team’s forecheck is overloading and net front D is an option
teaching_points: Good shooting options from the point
Tag up and pivot to inside the dots and retrieve
D passes on tape and net front D ready for a breakout pass

title: DEFENCE – BREAKOUT – CORNER TO NET FRONT
instructions: D cross and take a onetime shot, tag up at blue line and initiate breakout.; Retrieve puck, D-D to wing; Retrieve second puck, cut up ice, D-D net front.
teaching_points: Good shooting options from the point
Tag up and pivot to inside the dots and retrieve
D passes on the tape
Eyes up ice looking at all options

title: U11 - SKATING – SKATING STATIONS
instructions: Have players line up in two lines across from each other. Perform various skating techniques towards the line opposite.
teaching_points: Single Leg Strides
Single Leg Backwards C-cuts
Alternating Single Leg Strides
Alternating Single Leg Backwards C-cuts
Full Speed Forward Sprint
Full Speed Backward Sprint

title: U11 - SKATING AGILITY SKATING STATIONS
instructions: Set up two lines of players facing opposite each other with staggered pylons in between them. Perform various agility skating techniques towards the line opposite.
teaching_points: Two Foot Turns
Outside Heel Pumps
Heel to Heel
360 Tight Turns
Backward/Forward Pivots
Inside Edge Jumps

title: U11 - SKATING – AGILITY SKATING STATIONS #2
instructions: Place four pylons in a diamond formation with a line of players at each end.; One player leaves at a time skating different agility patterns through the pylons.
teaching_points: Backward Pivot, Forward Pivot, Weave
Backward Pivot, Stop, Forward Skate
Backward Pivot, 360 Spin, Forward Skate
Progression: Add a chaser

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS
instructions: Place three pylons in a triangle formation. On the whistle, one puck carrier leaves and skates a tight turn around the side pylon before proceeding to accelerate around the other pylons and taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Explosive starts
Quick feet and acceleration through turns
Head up and quick hands

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #2
instructions: Place three pylons in an upside down triangle formation. Players leave with a puck and skate perform a pivot-360 spin around each side pylon before skating down the center of the formation and taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Head up
Keep puck close to body for control

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #3
instructions: Place three pylons in an upside down triangle formation. Players leave with a puck and skate perform a backward pivot around each side pylon before skating down the center of the formation and taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Head up
Keep puck close to body for control

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #4
instructions: Place three pylons in an upside down triangle formation. Players leave with a puck and skate a figure 8 around the side and bottom pylons before proceeding to take a shot on net.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Head up
Keep puck close to body for control

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #5
instructions: Place three pylons in a straight line. Players leave with a puck and perform two backward pivot-360 turns around the pylons before taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Head up
Keep puck close to body for control
Quick transitions

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #6
instructions: Two players start in the corner with a puck. The first player leaves up the wall and cycles down to the second player. After receiving the cycle, the second player passes to the first player in the slot for a shot on net.
teaching_points: Passes on the tape
Head up and aim your shots
Receive pass, no dust

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #7
instructions: Place pylons in an upside down triangle formation. Have puck carriers skate tight turns around both sides of the formation before taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Accelerate out of turns
Keep head up and aim shots

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #8
instructions: Place three pylons in a straight line. Players leave with a puck and perform backwards pivots around the top pylons and 360 tight turns around the bottom pylons before taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Accelerate out of turns
Keep head up and aim shots

title: U11 - PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL STATIONS #9
instructions: Two players start in the corner with a puck. The first player leaves with a puck and skates a tight turn around a pylon at the top of the circle. The puck carrier then plays give and go with the second player and takes a shot on net.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet around turns
Quick passes on the tape
Receive pass with head up and aim shot
No dust

title: SKATING – PUCK CONTROL – HALF ICE LANES
instructions: Four lanes/ groups are created with the setup of pylons and sticks; We want to maximize repetitions and use progressions that players will use to create deception, quick hands and puck control skills; Coaches are encouraged to be creative with this template
teaching_points: Explosive starts and quick stops
Heads up and use of peripheral vision
Quick hands and feet
Put the puck in the safest place and protect it
Repetition without boredom

title: U11 - SKATING – PUCK CONTROL – HALF ICE LANES
instructions: Four lanes/ groups are created with the setup of pylons and sticks; Players skate down their lanes performing various skating/puck control skills
teaching_points: Inside edge, with & without puck
Outside edge, with & without puck
Outside edge, quick feet crosses
Crossovers, with & without puck
Backwards & open pivots

title: SKATING – PUCK CONTROL – HALF ICE LANES #2
instructions: Four lanes/ groups are created with the setup of pylons and sticks; We want to maximize repetitions and use progressions that players will use to create deception, quick hands and puck control skills; Coaches are encouraged to be creative with this template
teaching_points: Explosive starts and quick stops
Heads up and use of peripheral vision
Quick hands and feet
Put the puck in the safest place and protect it
Repetition without boredom

title: PUCK CONTROL - HALF ICE LANES
instructions: Four lanes/ groups are created with the setup of pylons and sticks; We want to maximize repetitions and use progressions that players will use to create deception, quick hands and puck control skills; Coaches are encouraged to be creative with this template
teaching_points: Explosive starts and quick stops
Heads up and use of peripheral vision
Quick hands and feet
Put the puck in the safest place and protect it
Repetition without boredom

title: PASSING – HALF ICE LANES
instructions: Four lanes/ groups are created with the setup of pylons and sticks; We want to maximize repetitions and use progressions that players will use to create deception, quick hands and puck control skills; Coaches are encouraged to be creative with this template
teaching_points: Focus and good passing techniques
Head up and watch puck onto stick
Control puck and be ready to pass immediately
Work on forward and backhand passing
Repetition without boredom

title: PUCK CONTROL – CIRCLE CHAOS – ESCAPE
instructions: Four players control pucks inside the faceoff circle working on puck protection and evasive maneuvers. Players use escape moves in a small area to avoid being checked.
teaching_points: Quick Hands
Keep puck close to body for control
Be evasive

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION – SPIN OFF PRESSURE
instructions: In this drill, the first player in line passes to a stationary player who is in ready position. After receiving the pass, the second player turns to protect the puck from the first player who applies pressure. The second player reads which direction the pressure is coming from and spins in the opposite direction. He/she then passes to the next person in line and the drill is continuous.
teaching_points: Use your body to protect the puck
Shoulder check to see which direction the pressure is coming from
Wait until the forechecker is in your ‘pocket’ before spinning off pressure

title: DEFENCE – 1 ON 1 – LATERAL SKATING
instructions: Player with the puck skates the wall protecting the puck; Defensive player adds passive resistance
teaching_points: Offensive player protects the puck by keeping it as far away from checker as possible
Offensive player will lean into the pressure to create time and space
Player can use two hands on stick and can progress to using one hand and “pushing away” fore-checkers stick

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION NET DRIVE
instructions: On the whistle two players leave the corner at the same time. The puck carrier drives around the top of the circle while protecting the puck from the second player. Once around the top of the circle, the puck carrier drives the net and attempts to take a shot on net.
teaching_points: Keep the puck out wide to protect it from the defending player
Use a strong knee drive to create enough separation from the defending player to take a shot on net
Keep your feet moving for acceleration

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION – DELAY
instructions: On the whistle two players leave the corner at the same time. The puck carrier drives to the top of the circle before performing a delay down the wall and then attacks the net. The defending player gives chase and applies pressure.
teaching_points: Keep the puck out wide to protect it from the defending player
Use a strong knee drive to create enough separation from the defending player to take a shot on net
Keep your feet moving for acceleration

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION PROGRESSIONS
instructions: Two players skate up and down the half wall working on various puck protection skills.
teaching_points: Tight Turns – With/Without Pucks
Heel to Heel – With/Without Pucks
Random Moves – With/Without Pucks
1 on 1 – Mirror – With/Without Puck
Figure 8 Pattern – Tight turns, Heel to Heel, Random Moves – Pass with coach

title: U11 - DEFENCE – D SIDE POSITIONING
instructions: The drill begins with a defensive player passing a puck through the legs of an offensive player. The offensive player must find the puck and try to attack the net. The defensive player works on defensive side positioning and defends the net.
teaching_points: Close the gap early
Eliminate time and space
Use an active stick and keep stick on puck
Keep good defensive body positioning

title: U11 - DEFENCE – D SIDE POSITIONING – GIVE AND GO
instructions: The drill begins with a defensive player passing a puck through the legs of an offensive player. The offensive players find the puck and both play 1 on 1 on the wall. On the coach’s signal, the puck carrier cycles the puck and plays give and go with the defensive player before taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Close the gap early
Eliminate time and space
Use an active stick and keep stick on puck
Keep good defensive body positioning
Passes on the tape
Head up and aim your shot

title: U11 - DEFENCE RETRIEVALS - 1 ON 1
instructions: Coach dumps puck and two players compete. First player to cross the blue line with the puck wins; Use dividers for safety
teaching_points: Opportunity for players to practice breakout deception skills as well as forechecking and angling skills
Younger players can angle, control their skating, use their stick and bantams and up can add body contact
There are no obstacles so creating and limiting time and space are key to success

title: NWT – SHOOTING – HI-LO BACKDOOR PLAY
instructions: F1 starts beside the net on the goal line, F2 starts in the slot. The puck will start with the coach and go from the blue line to F1. At the same time, F2 skates toward the blue line, and will do a tight turn around a pylon set between the blue-line and ringette line. F1 will go around the obstacle in the faceoff circle, and make a backdoor pass to F2 driving the net.
teaching_points: Drive the net hard and stop on the puck
Finish rebounds
Pass hard

title: NWT – SHOOTING – 3 SHOTS IN SLOT
instructions: Player 1 start in the corner with pucks. Player 2 start in the slot. Player 1 pass to player 2 for a one timer. Player 2 will then find open ice for a second one timer from player 1. Coach will then release a puck to an area for player 2 to take a third shot.

title: NWT – SHOOTING - 3 SHOT SCORING
instructions: Player 1 start in the corner with pucks. Player 2 start in the slot. Player 1 pass to player 2 for two one timers. Player 2 will then find open ice for a second one timer from player 1. Coach will then release a puck to an area for player 2 to take a third shot.

title: NWT – SCORING – 3 X RIM PICKUP
instructions: Coach will be in the corner and rim three pucks to the far side. Player 1 will receive the first rim and drive the net high. Player 1 will then receive the second rim and drive the net low. Player one will then receive the third rim and take it around the net, then pass to player 2 in the slot.
teaching_points: Stop on pucks
Protect puck with body
Keep eyes up

title: NWT – PUCK CONTROL – TRIANGLE TRANSITION
instructions: Three pylons are set up in a triangle. Player will attack each pylon in a random order, working on hands and feet, then finish with a fake on the net, and a shot.
teaching_points: Head up – work on keeping eyes up as much as possible
Fake on every pylon

title: NWT – PUCK CONTROL - TRANSITION TRIANGLE WITH 2ND SHOT
instructions: Three pylons are set up in a triangle. Player will attack each pylon in a random order, working on hands and feet, then finish with a fake on the net, and a shot. Receive pass from coach for second shot.

title: NWT – PUCK CONTROL – TIGHT TURN #2
instructions: Three pylons are set up in a triangle. Player will attack each pylon in a random order, working on hands and using tight turns, then finish with a fake on the net, and a shot.

title: NWT – PUCK CONTROL – TIGHT TURN
instructions: Three pylons are set up in a triangle. Player will attack each pylon in a random order, working on hands and using tight turns, then finish with a fake on the net, and a shot.

title: NWT - PASSING – TRANSITION PASSING
instructions: Transition skate figure 8’s facing your partner. Receive pass on ends, pass back in the middle.
teaching_points: Provide a target
Pass hard
Eyes up

title: NWT – PASSING – TRANSITION ESCAPE PASSING
instructions: Transition skate figure 8’s, doing an escape move at the ends, passing back to your partner in the middle.

title: SKATING – SKATING STRIDE ON PUCKS
instructions: Start with one foot planted on the ice, and the other balanced on a puck. Continuously stride out on the puck, returning it to hockey stance.
teaching_points: Exaggerate knee bend
Eyes up
Watch arm pump

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL - TIGHT TURNS #2
instructions: Player will start at the bottom of the circle with a puck. Pylons are placed in the circle in a cross. Player will do four figure 8’s, one in each direction, returning to the middle every time.
teaching_points: Keep head up out of turns
Do not tuck hands - Keep in front of you
Cross over out of turns

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK CONTROL – TIGHT TURNS
instructions: Player will start at the bottom of the circle with a puck. Pylons are placed in the circle in a cross. Player will do 4 tight turns around the pylons placed on perimeter of circle, returning to the middle pylon every time.
teaching_points: Keep head up out of turns
Do not tuck hands - Keep in front of you
Cross over out of turns

title: SCORING – GIVE AND GO – FIND THE LANE
instructions: Start the drill with a line of forwards in the corner, and defencemen at the blue line. Puck will go from forward to defenceman. Defenceman will walk the line, while forward finds open ice along the wall. Defenceman will pass to the forward, who will find the lane between two defenders, and attack the net.
teaching_points: Drive hard off wall
Puck protection

title: SHOOTING – QUICK RELEASE – BACKHAND RECEPTION
instructions: Skaters will line up on each blue line (right-handed players on the right wing and vice versa). Players will skate towards the middle the ice, heading towards the slot. The coach from the same side will give them a pass. Players receive puck on backhand and take a quick release shot on net.
teaching_points: Head up while shooting
Rotate body around puck
Lean into shot

title: SHOOTING – QUICK RELEASE OFF BAD PASS
instructions: Skaters will line up on each blue line and skate towards the middle the ice, heading towards the slot. The coach from the same side will give them a bad pass which they are to locate, bring to stick, and take a quick release shot.
teaching_points: Head up while shooting
Rotate body around puck
Lean into shot

title: SHOOTING – QUICK RELEASE OFF PASS
instructions: Skaters will line up on each blue line and skate towards the middle the ice, heading towards the slot. The coach from the same side will give them a pass. Players receive puck and take a quick release shot on net.
teaching_points: Head up while shooting
Rotate body around puck
Lean into shot

title: SHOOTING – NET SEQUENCE
instructions: Player stands facing the net. Next player in line will pass puck through first layers legs. Player will locate the puck, taking it around the net for a shot. The player will then toe drag one of the scattered pucks from the net, and take it around for a second shot.; Player stands facing the net. Next player in line will pass puck through first layers legs. Player will locate the puck, taking it around the net using an escape move for a shot. The player will then toe drag one of the scattered pucks from the net, and do another escape move before taking a second shot.; Player takes a one timer from the point. Then takes a fake one timer and walks puck toward middle for second shot. The player then toe drags one of the scattered pucks from the net for a quick release shot.
teaching_points: Head up while shooting
Sell fakes

title: SHOOTING – TOE DRAG THE NET
instructions: Player starts on blue line and toe drags one of the scattered pucks from the net, and take a quick release shot. Then comes back around, toe drag another puck from the net and shoot. As a progression – add defender to chase.

title: PUCK CONTROL – HANDS – FEET AGILITY #2
instructions: Set up two danglers a few feet apart. Players will be released, doing moves around both danglers using quick hands and feet, finishing with a shot on net.

title: PUCK CONTROL – HANDS – FEET AGILITY
instructions: Set up two danglers a few feet apart. Players will be released, doing moves around both danglers using quick hands and feet, finishing with a shot on net.

title: PUCK CONTROL – SMALL AREA HANDS #2
instructions: Place pucks, pylons and danglers in the circle. Player enters circle using quick hands to avoid objects. Skate around net on opposite side of circle, finish with a shot.
teaching_points: Keep eyes up while skating

title: PUCK CONTROL – SMALL AREA HANDS
instructions: Place objects on one half of the ice. Release 4 players into the zone in a scramble. Players need to use evasive moves around objects while avoiding other players. Players shoot one by one.
teaching_points: Heads up
Sell fakes
Go faster than you are comfortable with

title: PUCK CONTROL – CONFINED SPACE CREATIVITY
instructions: Release player into one half of the ice. Have objects placed sporadically. Player use evasive moves to avoid objects, finish with a shot.
teaching_points: Heads up
Sell fakes
Go faster than you are comfortable with

title: PUCK CONTROL – RANDOM NZ CREATIVITY
instructions: Place random obstacles in the neutral zone. Each player leaves carrying a puck and performs random creative puck control moves through the obstacles.
teaching_points: Challenge yourself
Be Creative
Eyes up as much as possible
Quick Hands

title: PUCK CONTROL – CIRCLE PUCK PROTECTION #2
instructions: In this drill, a puck carrier controls a puck around the faceoff circle stickhandling around players that are lined up around the outside of the circle. Defensive players can apply more pressure by moving their sticks. The puck carrier works on various puck protection techniques.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Puck Protection Skills – Heel to Heel, One hand, etc.
Be creative

title: PUCK CONTROL – CIRCLE PUCK PROTECTION
instructions: In this drill, a puck carrier controls a puck around the faceoff circle stickhandling around players that are lined up around the outside of the circle. The puck carrier works on various puck protection techniques.
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Puck Protection Skills – Heel to Heel, One hand, etc.
Be creative

title: DEFENCE – OFFENCE – LOOSE PUCK RACES – GIVE AND GO
instructions: A coach spots a puck for two players who race to gain possession. After a few seconds of 1 on 1, the coach will blow the whistle and the two players will play give and go in the corner before taking a shot on net.
teaching_points: Explosive Starts
Puck Protection Skills
D Side Positioning
Passes on the tape
Aim your shot

title: SMALL AREA GAME – LOOSE PUCK RACES
instructions: Two players stand an equal distance away from a coach who is holding a puck. When the coach drops the puck, both players race to gain possession. The drill immediately turns into a 1 on 1 with the puck carrier trying to score on the net.
teaching_points: Explosive starts
Net Drive
Puck Protection
D Side Positioning

title: DEFENCE – D SIDE POSITIONING
instructions: In this D Side Positioning drill, the defensive player mirrors a puck carrier on the half wall. On the coach’s whistle the puck carrier drives the net and takes a shot.
teaching_points: Defensive player should sit in the pocket of the puck carrier and keep stick on puck when changing directions
Read and React
D Side Positioning – Stay below puck

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION PROGRESSION #2
instructions: Two players skate up and down the half wall working on various puck protection skills.
teaching_points: Figure 8 Pattern – Tight Turns, Heel to Heel, Random Moves – Pass With Coach

title: PUCK CONTROL – PUCK PROTECTION PROGRESSION
instructions: Two players skate up and down the half wall working on various puck protection skills.
teaching_points: Tight Turns – With/Without Pucks
Heel to Heel – With/Without Pucks
Random Moves – With/Without Pucks

title: CHECKING SKILLS – PUCK RETRIEVAL – CUSHION HIT
instructions: Defensive player needs to protect themselves when fore-checker is right on them. Defensive player will make contact with forechecker before going into the boards. Get hands up and absorb the check first, then play the puck, often with your feet. Forechecker needs to respect the defensive player and not run them from behind
teaching_points: Defensive player gets inside position and makes contact before the boards so both players go in together.
Defensive player gets hands up on the glass to absorb the contact
Defensive player then plays the puck either with feet or stick
Defensive player can initiate contact of forecheckers body or stick

title: DEFENCE – SKATING – PIVOT – PASS – SHOOT SEQUENCE
instructions: Players start backwards and skate neutral zone; Players stride and move laterally without crossing over; Players get to wall with two options: stride or crossover; Retrieve the puck and pass to defenseman at blue line and shoot; Jump up ice after your pass, drag and shoot
teaching_points: Start backwards with one crossover and then striding
Players push and recover their stride with no crossovers
Good knee bend, upright upper body, stick on ice and eyes up
Stay “in the saddle” and pump arms north-south
Move laterally with no crossovers and also with one crossover
Try to pick the puck up toes up ice
After your pass “chase the puck up the ice”
Good shooting techniques and options from the blue line

title: DEFENCE – SKATING – FULL ICE PIVOT
instructions: Players start backwards and skate neutral zone; Players stride and move laterally without crossing over; Players get to wall with two options: stride or crossover
teaching_points: Start backwards with one crossover and then striding
Players push and recover their stride with no crossovers
Good knee bend, upright upper body, stick on ice and eyes up
Stay “in the saddle” and pump arms north-south
Move laterally with no crossovers and also with one crossover

title: DEFENCE – SKATING - HEELS AND HIPS TRANSITION TO OPEN PIVOT
instructions: Players step up and do a heels and hips transition then a pivot. One cross over allowed on forward to backward pivot; Both sides same time
teaching_points: Good body posture and knee bend
Avoid crossing your feet when possible.
Turn upper body first, pull in outside foot and load inside foot
Push and go

title: DEFENCE – SKATING – TOES FIRST TRANSITION TO OPEN PIVOT
instructions: Players step up and do a toes first transition then a pivot without crossing your feet; Both sides same time
teaching_points: Good body posture and knee bend
Avoid crossing your feet when possible. Whole drill should not have feet crossing
Turn upper body first, pull in outside foot and load inside foot
Push and go

title: DEFENCE – SKATING - OPEN PIVOT
instructions: Players push off the wall so they can focus on proper technique; Push, execute and repeat making corrections
teaching_points: Good body posture and knee bend
Avoid crossing your feet
Turn upper body first, pull in outside foot and load inside foot
Push and go

title: U11 - SKATING – SKATING ON PUCK – STRIDE
instructions: This drill focusses on stride extension. The player stands on a puck and works on full stride extension while holding balance and control.
teaching_points: 3 Point Extension – Hip, Knee, Ankle
Eyes Up
Balance & Coordination

title: U11 - SCORING – BREAKAWAY AND TIP
instructions: In this simple drill, the first player in line goes in on a breakaway working on scoring techniques. Following the breakaway, the player skates around the net and stops in front. A coach shoots a puck on net and looks for a deflection.
teaching_points: Use deceptive moves to score
Keep head up and look for holes
Stand in the goalie's eyes, make the goalie move around you

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – 1 ON 1 CHASE
instructions: The first player in line passes to a player below the goal line. The passer then gives chase and tries to catch the puck carrier. The puck carrier skates around the net and a pylon at the top of the faceoff circle before proceeding to take a shot on net.
teaching_points: Explosive starts
Puck carrier should keep head up and know where the forechecker is coming from
Quick hands around pylons
Aim your shots

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – CIRCLE 2 ON 2
instructions: Place nets at the top and the bottom of the faceoff circle. Dump a puck in and play small area 2on2.
teaching_points: Compete
Gain puck possession and control
Use support options/give and go plays
Puck protection skills
Evasive maneuvers to gain time and space

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – CORNER 1 ON 1
instructions: Place a net in the corner and have players make a semi-circle perimeter around the net. On the whistle, a puck is dumped in and two players play 1 on 1. The puck carrier can use the perimeter players as passing options. Go until someone scores or the coach blows it down.
teaching_points: Compete
Gain puck possession and control
Use support options/give and go plays
Puck protection skills

title: U11 - ANGLING – CROSS ICE ANGLING
instructions: On the whistle, a puck carrier and a defensive player leave at the same time. The puck carrier skates around the pylons nearest him/her and turns up ice. The defensive player must skate the width of the ice and angle the puck carrier to the wall.
teaching_points: Take a good angle, use your stick to direct the puck carrier
Move your feet early and close the gap
Do not allow the puck carrier to cut into the middle of the ice

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – PASS FOR POINTS
instructions: Three obstacles are placed around the zone. Players play 2 on 2 in the zone and must pass through the obstacles to one another to score points.
teaching_points: Move your feet to find open space
Support your partner and use all of the ice
Sticks in passing lanes

title: U11 - GOALTENDING – HANDS – REBOUND CONTROL
instructions: In this drill, a stationary player shoots pucks at the hands of the goaltender. The goaltender works on controlling his/her rebounds into an adjacent net.
teaching_points: Follow the puck to your hands and direct it into adjacent net
Square up with post and check angles

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – 2 ON 2 CROSS ICE
instructions: The drill begins with two 1 on 1 battles at each end of the ice. On the whistle, one puck is eliminated and the drill turns into 2 on 2, cross ice.
teaching_points: Use explosive starts to gain puck possession first.
Use puck protection skills and quick feet to try and attack the net
Keep head up and use partner support to make plays

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – CONTINUOUS 1 ON 1
instructions: 1-1 battle game with a transition.; Offensive player tries to score. Defensive player defends. When defensive player passes to player on the blue line, that player attack and the player who was on offense is now the defender. The original defensive player is done when his pass is completed
teaching_points: Good opportunity for offensive player to attack the net, protect the puck and create scoring chances. Defensive player needs to utilize good individual defensive tactics and limit time and space. Defensive player must move the puck to the open player
Good transition from offense to defence and vice versa

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – READ AND REACT GAP #2
instructions: One player is the offensive player for the whole drill and one defensive player…. they can alternate each time; Offensive player starts with the puck and when coach blows whistle, players leave their puck and offensive player picks up new puck spotted by coach. Defensive player reacts
teaching_points: Offensive player tries to get to all pucks as quickly as possible and attack the net. They need to take the puck to the net and protect it as well
Defensive player tries to keep a tight gap laterally and horizontally. Stay defensive side, use stick and practice good 1-1 individual defensive tactics

title: U11 - SMALL AREA GAME – READ AND REACT GAP
instructions: One player is the offensive player for the whole drill and one defensive player…. they can alternate each time; Offensive player starts with the puck and when coach blows whistle, players leave their puck and offensive player picks up new puck spotted by coach. Defensive player reacts
teaching_points: Offensive player tries to get to all pucks as quickly as possible and attack the net. They need to take the puck to the net and protect it as well
Defensive player tries to keep a tight gap laterally and horizontally. Stay defensive side, use stick and practice good 1-1 individual defensive tactics

title: IP - 3 STATION SET UP #1 – SKATING – AGILITY COURSE
IP - 3 STATION SET UP #1 – SKATING – AGILITY NETS #1
IP - 3 STATION SET UP #1 – SKATING – AGILITY NETS #2
IP - 3 STATION SET UP #1 – SKATING – AGILITY NETS #3
IP - 3 STATION SET UP #1 – SKATING – TIGHT TURN RELAY RACES
IP - 3 STATION SET UP #2 – CROSS ICE HOCKEY
IP - 3 STATION SKILLS – SAG – CROSS ICE HAND SOCCER
IP - 3 STATION SKILLS – SKATING – CROSSOVER RACE
IP - 4 STATION – 3 QUARTER SPLIT – CORNER SCRIMMAGE
IP - 4 STATION – 3 QUARTER SPLIT – DIAGONAL SCRIMMAGE
IP - 4 STATION – 3 QUARTER SPLIT – LANE PUCK HANDLING
IP - 4 STATION – 3 QUARTER SPLIT – LANE SKATING
IP - 4 STATION – HALF ICE #1 – PUCK CONTROL WEAVE
IP - 4 STATION – HALF ICE #2 – 4 PYLON CHASE
IP - 4 STATION – HALF ICE #2 – BACKYARD DRILL
IP - 4 STATION – HALF ICE #2 – PUCK CONTROL – OBSTACLES
IP - 4 STATION – HALF ICE #2 – PUCK CONTROL – RETRIEVAL
IP - 4 STATION SET UP #2 – AGILITY PUCK HANDLING OBSTACLE COURSE
IP - 4 STATION SET UP #2 – BACKWARDS STOPPING
IP - 4 STATION SET UP #2 – PASSING – PYLON TARGET PASSING
IP - 4 STATION SET UP #2 – PUCK HANDLING – 4 MINI NETS
IP - 4 STATION SKATING – FORWARD TO BACKWARD PIVOTS
IP - 5 STATION – PUCK CONTROL – ATTACK THE TRIANGLE
U9 - SKATING WARMUP – EDGES
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and then back along the boards; Perform each skating skill as shown:; Stride and Bend; Inside Edge; Jump Stride; Outside Edge
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: U9 - SKATING WARMUP - EDGES 2
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and then back along the boards; Perform each skating skill as shown:; Bubbles; Jump Bubbles; 1 - leg C-Cuts; Alternating C-Cuts
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: U9 – SKATING WARMUP - EDGES 3
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and then back along the boards; Perform each skating skill as shown:SlalomSlalom Lead with Inside Foot; Slalom; Slalom Lead with Inside Foot; Scissors
teaching_points: Slalom
Slalom Lead with Inside Foot

title: U9 - SKATING WARM UP - TURNING AND CROSSOVERS
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and then back along the boards; Perform each skating skill as shown:; Crossovers; Pivots
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.
For crossovers:
Toes around, accelerate out
Toes up ice as much as possible
For pivots:
Light on their feet
Focus on shifting weight when in transition

title: U9 - PUCK CONTROL WARM UP 1
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards; Perform each puck control skill as shown:; Wide Puck Control; Quick hands - Narrow; Narrow – Wide; Toes Up; Side – Middle - Side
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up. Have players try to get as many reps of each skill as possible down the ice.
Encourage quick hands and lots of range of motion

title: U9 - PUCK CONTROL WARM UP 2 - OPEN ICE CARRY
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards; Players use only their top hand to control the stick; Players should first push the puck on their forehand, followed by their backhand
teaching_points: The puck must be out in front and off to the side of the body for maximum control
Straightening the arm at the elbow pushes the puck forward

title: U9 - PUCK CONTROL WARM UP 3 - AGILITY
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards; Perform each puck control skill as shown:; Crossovers; Pivots; Heel to heel; 360s; Toe Drags
teaching_points: Encourage players to be creative and try something new
Have players try to get as many reps of each skill as possible down the ice
Encourage quick hands and lots of range of motion

title: U9 - HALF ICE WARM UP - FULL ICE LENGTH
instructions: Players line up in the corner and skate out around a pylon in the neutral zone and return back to start line. Option to finish with a shot on goal; Perform each puck control skill as shown.; Narrow Quick Hands; Wide; Push-Pull; Side-Middle-Side
teaching_points: Players line up at the bottom of the circle and skate to a pylon outside the blue line before returning along the boards.
Perform various skating skills such as:
C-Cuts
Bubbles
Pivots
Heel to heel

title: U9 - 4 STATION SKATING #1
instructions: Split the ice up into 4 stations. Split both the offensive zone and the neutral zone into two stations.; Station work allows players to work on developing their skills before moving into drills.

title: U9 - 4 STATION SKATING – CROSSOVERS
instructions: Release players one by one to skate around the circle beginning with c-cuts and progressing to:; Crossunders; Exaggerated Crossovers; Quick Crossovers; Crossovers with pucks
teaching_points: Practice both directions as players need to become sufficient with crossing over both ways.
Players should understand that this drill is not a race and the movement should be done correctly.

title: U9 - 4 STATION SKATING - GLIDE & TIGHT TURNS
instructions: Place two pylons 10 to 12 feet apart.; Players line up along the boards and complete glides and tight turns around the pylons in a figure 8 pattern.; Add a chaser after each player has completed a few reps.
teaching_points: Knees bent
Skates close together
Follow the stick into the turn

title: U9 - 4 STATION SKATING - AGILITY NETS
instructions: Place a net in the middle of the station; Players perform different skating techniques around the net to work on quickness and agility:; Crossovers; Tight turns; Stops; Heel to heel; Add a chaser to increase quickness
teaching_points: Bent knees
Quick feet
Stick leads into the turn

title: U9 - 4 STATION SKATING - TRANSITION
instructions: Place two pylons at the top of the circle; Players start at the bottom of the circle and skate forward to the pylon; Pivot backwards to the bottom of the circle; Repeat on both sides; Try one foot, heel to heel, or add a puck for a progression
teaching_points: Quick feet
Maintain speed coming out of the pivot

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL
instructions: Split the ice up into 4 stations. Split both the offensive zone and the neutral zone into two stations.; Station work allows players to work on developing their skills before moving into drills.

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - 4 PYLON AGILITY
instructions: Place 4 pylons around a circle or in a square in any small area of the ice; Players start by skating around the pylons in a random fashion; Progression - carry a puck and stickhandle around the pylons in a random fashion finishing with a shot on net; Progression:; Add a second player to encourage players to keep their heads up; Add a second player to chase the first player creating a high speed, evasive scenario
teaching_points: Keep feet moving
Be creative
Quick hands and feet

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - 1 ON 0 ATTACK MOVES
instructions: Place obstacles throughout the station; Players attack each obstacle in a random fashion; Players should try a variety of 1-1 attack tactics on the stationary obstacles
teaching_points: Encourage creativity
Protect the puck
Head up
Quick hands and feet

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - 1 ON 1 MOVES
instructions: Create a line using pylons and a coach or player to act as a obstacles between the pylons; Players will start by attacking the first pylon with a creative move, protect the puck from the defender, and do a quick turn around the top pylon, performing the same moves back to starting line; Add a chaser for a progression
teaching_points: Quick hands and feet
Protect the puck
Encourage creativity

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - DELAY NET DRIVE
instructions: Players start along the boards, skate to a pylon below the hashmarks, delay towards the boards, and then attack the net; Add a chaser for a progression
teaching_points: Keep feet moving
Attack with speed
Protect puck on the delay

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL #2
instructions: Split the ice up into 4 stations. Split both the offensive zone and the neutral zone into two stations.; Station work allows players to work on developing their skills before moving into drills.

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - STATIONARY PUCK CONTROL
instructions: Place obstacles throughout the circle; Begin with players stationary in the circle working on the following puck control techniques:
teaching_points: For a progression, add a 360 degree turn while stationary
To finish, have the players move throughout the station and around the obstacles while working on the above puck control techniques.

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - 5 PUCK AGILITY
instructions: Place 5 pucks in the station as shown; Players must skate around each of the outside pucks and come back to the middle before skating around one of the outside pucks again; Keep toes pointing forward during transition
teaching_points: Quick feet, stay low for balance
Efficient movements – try to only do 1 crossover to get back to the middle

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - LAND MINES
instructions: Randomly spread pucks throughout the station; Players perform puck control skills around and between pucks
teaching_points: Maintain control of the puck
Encourage creativity
Quick feet and quick hands

title: U9 - 4 STATION PUCK CONTROL - AGILITY NETS
instructions: Place two nets in the face-off circle; Players perform puckhandling techniques to work on quickness, agility, and creativity while skating around the nets; Finish with a shot; Add a second player to encourage players to keep their heads up or to act as a defender
teaching_points: Encourage creativity
Heads up
Quick hands and feet

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS
instructions: Split the ice up into 3 stations. Split the offensive zone into two stations.; Station work allows players to work on developing their skills before moving into drills.

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - AGILITY NETS - HEEL TO HEEL
instructions: Place a net in the middle of the face-off circle; Players perform puck control skills and heel to heel around the net; Finish with a shot on net; Add a chaser for a progression
teaching_points: Encourage creativity
Open knees to get heels to face each other
Quick hands and feet

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - NZ SKATING
instructions: Arrange alternating pylons in two lines across the neutral zone station; Players skate forward to the first pylon, pivot, skate backwards to the next pylon, pivot to forwards and repeat; For a progression, add a puck
teaching_points: Quick feet
Maintain speed coming out of the pivot

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - SKATING RACES
instructions: Start with 2 lines, each with 2 pylons in a vertical line; Players start at the bottom pylon and on the coach’s signal, race to the top pylon and back performing the following skating techniques:; Tight Turn; Pivot; Two Foot Stop
teaching_points: Repeat on both sides
Quick feet
Stay low
Heads up

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS #2
instructions: Split the ice up into 3 stations. Split the offensive zone into two stations.; Station work allows players to work on developing their skills before moving into drills.

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - PYLON CROSSOVER RACE
instructions: Place 3 pylons around the face-off circle; Split players into two teams and have them line up around the circle; On the whistle, three players perform crossovers around the circle trying to catch the person in front of them; For a progression: complete the crossovers backwards or add heel to heel
teaching_points: Players should be constantly crossing over
Compete
Quick feet
Stay low

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - AGILITY STICKS
instructions: Place obstacles in 2 lines across the station; On the whistle, players leave from the boards with a puck stickhandling around the obstacles working on different skills:; Puck under stick; Forehand only; Forehand to backhand; Pull puck back; Random moves
teaching_points: Keep heads up
Speed is not important. The drill should be done correctly with proper technique before increasing speed
Encourage creativity

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - TRANSITION AGILITY SKATING
instructions: Place 3 pylons in a triangle shape around the circle; Players skate to the top pylon and then return to the bottom pylon performing different transition skating techniques:; Pivots; Two foot stops; Heel to heel; For a progression, make it a race or add a chaser
teaching_points: Quick feet
Stay low for balance

title: U9 - 3 STATION SMALL AREA GAME
instructions: Split the ice up into 3 stations. Split the offensive zone into two stations and create one station in the neutral zone.

title: U9 - 3 STATION SMALL AREA GAME - 1 ON 1 - 2 ON 2 CROSS ICE
instructions: Small area game starts with 4 players partnered up in the middle of the neutral zone; Each pair has a puck; On the whistle, each pair starts to play 1 on 1; Reset in the middle of the neutral zone with one puck; On the whistle, 2 on 2 begins
teaching_points: Compete for the puck
When it becomes a 2 on 2, get open for the pass or stay D side on defence
Gain puck possession and control
Use puck protection skills

title: U9 – 3 STATION SMALL AREA GAME - CIRCLE 2 ON 2
instructions: Place a net at the bottom of the face-off circle; All 4 players start in the face-off circle; On the whistle, a puck is dumped in and players play 2 on 2; A new puck is dumped in on goals, saves, or pucks that go out of play
teaching_points: Compete for the puck
Gain puck possession and control
Use supportive options
Puck protection skills

title: U9 - SMALL AREA GAME - 3 X 1 ON 1
instructions: Three players line up across from each other in a designated small area; Place 3 pucks across the middle; On the whistle, players race for the puck; 3 games of 1 on 1 are played in designated small area
teaching_points: Compete for the puck
Puck protection skills
Gain puck possession and control

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS #3
instructions: Split the ice up into 3 stations. Split the offensive zone into two stations and create one station in the neutral zone.

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS – PASSING
instructions: Players line up across from a partner in one line; Starting with stationary, players pass the puck back and forth; For a progression, add moving and/or a quick turn upon receiving the pass
teaching_points: Ensure proper technique when giving and receiving the pass

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS – STOPPING
instructions: Set up 4 pylons in the station for players to skate to and stop as shown; Players start in the corner and skate to the first pylon and complete a full stop before skating to the next pylon; The players will make 4 stops before returning to the corner; For a progression, add the following:; Drop knee; One foot stop; Carry a puck; Quick turn or escape
teaching_points: Bent knees
Feet together

title: U9 - 3 STATION SKILLS - BWD SKATING
instructions: Start facing backwards and skate down the middle of the station to the boards and back along the rink dividers; Perform each skating skill as shown
teaching_points: Sit back in hockey stance
One hand on the stick

title: INDIVIDUAL TACTICS – CIRCLE 1 ON 1
instructions:
Place 2 players in a circle, one with a puck one without.; On coaches’ signal, player with puck tries to keep control of
    the puck by using body as a shield and moving side to side to
    shake the defender.; Defensive player tries to contain the puck carrier, using body
    position and keeping the stick on puck
teaching_points: Keep the feet moving
Protect puck using body and side to side puck movement
Stick on puck by defensive player

title: SKATING - WARM-UP 01 - FORWARDS
instructions: Stride and Bend; Jump Stride; Scissors - Forward/Backward/Reverse; Crossovers; Knee Drops

title: SKATING - WARM-UP 02 - FORWARDS
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and then back along the boards.; Perform each skating skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: SKATING/PUCK CONTROL - PUCK ON FOREHAND PIVOTS
instructions: Players always face the middle pylon; Keep puck on forehand, except on escape moves; Good shooting principles at blueline
teaching_points: Keep the puck on forehand
Keep speed in both backward-forward and forward-backward pivots
Try to keep crossing of your feet to a minimum

title: SKATING - PUCK CONTROL - PUCK PROTECTION
instructions: Place two sticks on the ice leaving a space between them as a lane to skate through.; Player skates in a figure 8 pattern protecting the puck – take bottom hand off stick when doing tight turn around end of each stick
teaching_points: Stay low, come out of turn tight to stick
Take bottom hand off to prevent stick check

title: CHECKING SKILLS – ANGLING – CORNER ANGLING
instructions:
Pucks and players in faceoff circle.; Coach dumps puck into corner, player on inside skates
    towards corner and retrieves puck.; Player on outside, must take proper path and angle to force
    the puck carrier up the boards so the puck can be turned
    over; Must match speed of offensive player, stick on stick ( stick on
    puck ) and be in a position so the puck carrier cannot turn
    back the other way
teaching_points: Control Skate, take proper pathway

Stick on Puck, force puck carrier into poor position so puck
    can be taken away

title: SMALL AREA GAME – COACHES’ CHOICE – 1 ON 1, 2 ON 2, 3 ON 3
instructions: Separate colors on the dots outside the blue line; Coaches’ choice – calls out 1 on 1, 2 on 2 or 3 on 3.; Players play until whistle and then next group jumps in.; Jump to offence on turnover
teaching_points: Compete, short shifts, high intensity
Coach looks for good matchups

title: SMALL AREA GAME - PASS FOR POINTS 2-2
instructions:
Players score a point for their team if they make a tape to
    tape pass between one of the 3 pylon “gates”.; If a puck goes outside the zone, coach dumps in a new one; Coach will yell “puck” if a new puck is in play. Whistle changes
    players and the puck must be left where it is by players
    going off; Play the game to 9 or whatever time frame fits
teaching_points:
Great game to teach both offensive support and defensive
    coverage

Offensive players need to read, react, get open and communicate.
    Show your stick, make eye contact and call for the
    pass

Defensive players need to identify their player to cover,
    communicate and be ready to “switch” coverage. Sticks on
    ice, close gaps and play as hard on defense as offense.

title: SKATING - WARM-UP 01 - BACKWARDS
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards.; Perform each backward skating skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: SKATING - WARM-UP 02 - BACKWARDS
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards.; Perform each backward skating skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up to give the players lots of repetition on technical aspects of skating.

title: SKATING - SKATING AGILITY WARM-UP
instructions: Players perform Crossover to  “slide stops” forwards and backwards; Skate in a zig zag pattern through the middle lane
teaching_points: Maintain a deep knee bend
Keep balance throughout “slide stops”
Work on quick feet

title: PUCK CONTROL - WARM-UP 01
instructions: Players line up in two lines on the hashmarks; Both lines can go at the same time, or each line can alternate, skating down the middle to the far end and back along the boards.; Perform each skill as shown.
teaching_points: Technique is important in this warm-up set up have players try to get as many reps of each skill as possible down the ice
Encourage quick hands and lots of range of motion

title: SKATING - AGILITY - 5 PUCK AGILITY
instructions: Place 5 pucks in circle as shown.; Player must skate around each of the outside pucks, and always come back to the middle before skating around one of the outside pucks again.; Toes always pointing forward during transitions; Add puck for progression
teaching_points: Quick feet, stay low for balance
Efficient movements ie try to do only 1 crossover to get back to middle

title: SKATING - AGILITY NETS
instructions: Place a net in the Neutral Zone or anywhere on the ice to use as a station.; Players perform skating techniques to work on quickness, agility and creativity.; Add a second player to work on heads up play or to act as a defender so players are working on offence and defence.

title: SKATING - AGILITY - PUCK PROTECTION
instructions: Place two sticks on the ice leaving a space between them as a lane to skate through.; Player skates in a figure 8 pattern protecting the puck – take bottom hand off stick when doing tight turn around end of each stick
teaching_points: Stay low, come out of turn tight to stick,
Take bottom hand off to prevent stick check

title: SKATING - CIRCLE SKATING - BACKWARDS
instructions: Players start in corner; Skate around circle backwards; Crossunder; Crossover reach, grab ice; Inside pivot, exit with 1 crossover
teaching_points: Outside foot must stay on ice
Inside foot ( push leg ) stays on ice as much as possible
Outside edge of inside foot

title: SKATING - DEFENCE AGILITY ESCAPES
instructions: Players do 3 skills: transition, escape and slide stop / step-up; Toes up ice, transition in front of the stick; Player then does an escape move; Player then slide stops, steps up and makes the pass; Good shooting principles at blue line
teaching_points: Quick feet, the faster the better
Defensemen should bend their knees and keep good balance
Get the puck on forehand as soon as possible

title: SKATING - DEFENCE AGILITY TRANSITION
instructions: Agility “slide stops” from forward to backward and backward to forward; Keep toes up ice and pivot in front of each stick; Good shooting principles on blue line
teaching_points: Keep your speed
Keep shoulders square and toes up ice
Get the puck on your forehand as soon as possible
Work on quick feet

title: SKATING - DEFENCE SKATING ESCAPES
instructions: Player line up facing each other inside blue line; Defensive player starts skating backwards trying to elude forward who acts as forechecker.  Quick, deceptive moves to try and lose the forechecker.  Start with no puck.; Forechecker tries to contain, angle and react, and use stick position to steer defenseman.; Add puck, defender must skate out of zone, If Offensive player gets puck then try to score
teaching_points: Quick Feet, deception, agility
Both players need to read and react
Turn into 1 on 1 for intensity and competition

title: SKATING - DEFENCE TRANSITION
instructions: Players start in corner and skate towards blue line.; Turn toes and then transition backward, stop and then go forward again; Turn toes, and then unweight to get heels around – minimize crossovers prior to stopping and then skating forward.
teaching_points: Turn both ways
Toes first and heels first
Accelerate out of slide stop

title: SKATING - DEFENSIVE ZONE STRAIGHT LINE SKATING
instructions: Player starts on dot and skates out and poke checks a puck; Recover to the middle and poke check all 4 pucks and recover to the dot
teaching_points: Straight line skating/ stops and starts when playing defense
Poke check pucks and recover back to middle in as straight a line as possible
Keep square to pucks
Keep head and shoulder over skates
do not lunge at the puck

title: SKATING - FORWARD STRIDE
instructions: Players skate straight line focusing on technique
teaching_points: Head up
Full stride through to toe
Drive arms
Stick out in front

title: SKATING - NEUTRAL ZONE AGILITY 01
instructions: Players execute a “slide stop” at each pylon; skate to next pylon slide stop and back to first pylon; Players will transition at second pylon and execute an escape at first pylon. Repeat at pylon 4 and 3; Players skate backwards and execute an escape at each pylon alternating between forward and backward
teaching_points: Slide stops need quick feet and maintaining speed on change of direction
Players need to have good knee bend on escapes. Turn head and shoulders first
Keep your speed

title: SKATING - NEUTRAL ZONE AGILITY 02
instructions: Players start on blue line in neutral zone.; Skate patterns as shown working on agility, balance and foot speed.; Controlled repetition to perform skating skills.
teaching_points: Change up pattern and go both ways to ensure repetition in turning and transitioning both ways.

title: SKATING - QUICK FEET CROSSOVERS
instructions: Players start in corner; Skate to first pylon, turn towards boards.  Stop at boards, and accelerate out with 2 – 3 quick crossovers to next pylon and repeat; Repeat with toes facing up ice entire time, grab ice and reach inside to accelerate out turn from backwards to forwards.; Repeat with pucks.
teaching_points: Toes around, accelerate out
Toes up ice as much as possible

title: SKATING - SKATING CIRCLES
instructions: Players start in line in the corner.; Perform skating skills around both circles to ensure skills are done equally both ways.; Crossunders / C-Cuts / Quick feet hi lo’s / Heel to heel back foot push / Heel to heel open up / Pivot inside with 1 crossover
teaching_points: Make sure technique is done correctly before speed.  Repeat each skill as many times as necessary until players get the footwork right

title: SKATING - TRANSITION FOOTWORK
instructions: Start by placing two pylons in a line.; Player starts at bottom pylon, skates forward to top pylon, pivots, skates backward to opposite side of the bottom pylon, pivots and skates forward on same side to top pylon, pivots, skates backwards to start.; Progression – Add puck
teaching_points: Quick feet, acceleration into and out of the pivot, maintain speed

title: SKATING - TRANSITION FOOTWORK RACES
instructions: Start by placing two pylons in a line.; Players start at bottom pylon, skates forward to top pylon, pivots, skates backward to opposite side of the bottom pylon, pivots and skates forward on same side to top pylon, pivots, skates backwards to start.; Progression – Add puck

title: SKATING - TRANSITION RACES
instructions: Start with 2 lines each with two pylons in a vertical line.; Players start at bottom pylon, on coach’s signal the player’s race to top pylon, pivot and skate backwards to bottom pylon.; Repeat by pivoting the opposite way the next time.
teaching_points: Efficient turns, blow as little snow as possible
Quick feet

title: SKATING - TRANSITION SKATING
instructions: Place 4 pylons around a circle or anywhere on the ice; Players start at bottom of circle and skate forward to top pylon - pivot  backwards to lower pylon – pivot forward to top pylon on other side; pivot backwards to lower pylon – pivot forwards to top of circle stop and skate forwards back to starting position.; Add a puck for a progression
teaching_points: Quick feet
Maintain speed coming out of the pivot

title: SKATING - HEEL TO HEEL
instructions: Place two sticks on the ice, player skates with heels facing each other in circular pattern around sticks - go both ways; Add second player to act as chaser – turn into a race, or tag; Quick feet, change directions
teaching_points: Take your stick with you, lean forward and open knees
Find balance point, turn hips, and unweight to change feet

title: SKATING - DEFENCE TRANSITION SKATING
instructions: Players start in corner and skate towards blue line.; Turn toes and then transition backward, stop and then go forward again; Turn toes, and then unweight to get heels around – minimize crossovers prior to stopping and then skating forward.
teaching_points: Turn both ways
Toes first and heels first
Accelerate out of slide stop

title: SKATING - KNEE DROPS
instructions: Player starts in circle down on one knee down; Alternate raising each leg, while other knee touches ice while stickhandling; Gain momentum and rhythm – drive knee up and forward when raising it. Try not touch knee to ice when lowering.; Eyes up, quick hands when stickhandling
teaching_points: Balance, and rhythm needed for control
Change speeds – quick, slow, quick

title: SKATING - ALTERNATING FEET EDGE CONTROL 02
instructions: Players start on any line on the ice. Skate forward, glide on one skate.; Pivot to backwards on the same skate, then open hips and step forward with opposite skate to glide forward again.; Repeat alternating each leg.
teaching_points: Stay in control, stick out in front and on ice
Bend knees and unweight to pivot front to back on same skate

title: SKATING - FIGURE 8 EDGE CONTROL
instructions: Place two pucks about 10 feet apart.; Player skates in a figure 8 pattern around the pucks.; Skate to the pylon on the outside edge of the inside foot, and spin on the same foot away from the pylon so the exit of the turn is on the inside edge
teaching_points: Perform at a speed you are comfortable with
Stick out in front
Knees bent
Cary momentum into and out of turn

title: SKATING - TRANSITION FIGURE 8
instructions: Place two pucks 10 feet apart; Skate in a Figure 8 pattern toes up ice; Puck must go around pylons
teaching_points: Keep square and balanced
Head up and control the puck

title: SKATING - HALF CIRCLE LATERAL SKATING
instructions: One defenseman will skate half circle with feet outside skating laterally. The other defenseman will skate facing him across the middle of the circle; First, skate and focus on lateral speed. Then go other way; Progression: player skating backwards laterally will skate with the puck and hand it off to other defenseman; Progression: players will skate the same pattern and will pass the puck the whole time, can use onetime passing
teaching_points: Good transition skating techniques
Head up, get the puck loaded, keep shoulders square
Quick feet, good balance

title: SKATING – TOE ON PUCK
instructions:
Start on blue line and place the toe of one skate on the puck,
    and use c-cuts with the other skate to propel across the ice.
teaching_points:
Weight has to be on drive leg, too much weight on puck will
    cause skater to lose balance.
Change direction and use other leg on way back

title: SKATING – 2 FOOT STOP
instructions:
Players start in corner. Skate forward to first pylon and
    perform a 2 foot stop. Skate forward to second pylon and
    perform a 2 foot stop in the other direction. Repeat at all
    pylons.
teaching_points: Ensure equal weight distributed on both feet

Unweight, extend legs and then flex knees as feet are turning
    to perform the stop

title: SKATING – TIGHT TURNS
instructions:
Place pylons as shown in the drill diagram ( can be done
    anywhere on the ice ); Players start by skating to far pylon, tight turn around far
    pylon, weave back through, tight turn at near pylon weave
    back through to far pylon for one more tight turn.
teaching_points: Head, shoulders, hips, skates around pylon

Try to keep weight off of heels of skates to prevent
    slowing down

title: SKATING – TRANSITION - HEELS FIRST
instructions:
Players focus on heels first transition from forward to backward; This is used when containing the rush; Always pivot to the middle of the ice; Players are allowed one crossover after pivot then get into
    backward stride; On transition from backward to forward players “ride” and
    do not cross feet; On backward to forward pivot, lift the foot in the direction
    you are going and “load” the other foot
teaching_points: Players need to have a good knee bend for balance
Keep chest and toes up ice
Limit the crossing of the feet as much as possible
Players to keep their head up, shoulders back and toes up ice
Heels and hips first to turn

title: SKATING – TRANSITION - RIDE INSIDE EDGE
instructions:
Players focus on transition which allows an aggressive gap
    but also the possibility of containing; Players going left will ride the inside right foot edge and
    have the left foot ready to either continue a “toes first”
    approach or hop and shift to a backward skating contain
    approach. Players going right will ride the inside left foot
    edge and have the right foot ready; This approach allows defensemen to read and then react to
    the attacking player; On transition from backward to forward, players will do a
    single “cross under” step and go forward
teaching_points: Players need to have a good knee bend for balance
Keep chest and toes up ice
Limit the crossing of the feet as much as possible
Players to keep their head up, shoulders back and toes up ice
Toes may actually “turn in” as you begin the pivot

title: SKATING – TRANSITION - TOES FIRST
instructions:
Players focus on toes first transition from forwards to
    backwards; This is most often used when aggressively closing the gap; Players point toes, “unload” and then start backward stride; Players are allowed one (or none) crossover after pivot then
    get into backward stride; On transition from backward to forward, players “ride” and
    do not cross feet; On backward to forward pivot, lift the foot in the direction
    you are going and “load” the other foot
teaching_points: Players need to have a good knee bend for balance
Keep chest and toes up ice
Limit the crossing of the feet as much as possible
Players to keep their head up, shoulders back and toes up ice

In shifting from forward to backward, “unload” your weight
    before skating backwards

title: PUCK CONTROL - WARM-UP 02 - RANDOM OBSTACLES
